Introducing the E7000 Series
1 Introducing the E7000 
Series
1
Introducing the E7000 Series
E7000 is an IP network based intercom and paging solution that 
allows you to:
• Control facility bell schedules, announcements, and tones.
• Create and manage zones and queues. 
• Manage station types, configuration, and Class of Service (CoS). 
• Manage users, roles, and permissions.
• Create routines that can be manually started or that automatically 
launch procedures, or sequences of actions, that the Nyquist sys-
tem executes as a result of input triggers. 
• Monitor check-in status of classrooms or other areas during an 
emergency event, such as a lockdown or evacuation.
E7000 simplifies routine and emergency network communications 
and allows the linking of administrative and staff locations within a 
single building, among multiple buildings throughout a campus, or 
across the entire district. 
E7000 features a built-in streaming Internet radio service – airable by 
TuneIn, and optional custom-tailored music selections from SOUND-
MACHINE, the premier music subscription service for business. Both 
Note: This manual describes the tasks, including configuration 
tasks, that you can perform if you are assigned an Admin role with 
proper permissions and if your station Type is an Admin Web 
Interface. If you are assigned a User role and your station’s Type is 
Web Interface, refer to the Non-Admin Web Interface User Guide 
and to "Performing Tasks Via the Dashboard” on page 293 of this 
manual. For information about roles, see "Managing Roles and 
Users” on page 199.
2
services can be used to schedule audio to play at specific times, such 
as when classes are changing.
Available feature-rich IP phones and purpose-built networked appli-
ances provide convenient communication, control, and interoperabil-
ity with third-party devices and systems such as access control, fire 
alarm, clock, and PBX systems.
The E7000 system supports the following hardware:
• Personal Computers (PCs), tablets, and Android and Windows 
mobile phones that support the full Google Chrome web browser 
to access the E7000 Admin Web user interface (UI) and the E7000 
Web UI (User Dashboard)
• E7000 certified Voice over IP (VoIP) phones
• Nyquist appliances
For information about the Nyquist appliances that work with the 
E7000 system, visit:
Figure 1-1, Example of E7000 Network
3
www.bogenedu.com
1.1
Understanding System Requirements
The E7000 web-based UI requires a secure Hypertext Transfer Proto-
col Secure (https) type network connection to the E7000 system 
server. Users can log in to the E7000 system using the Google 
Chrome web browser from a computer or tablet running either a 
Windows 8.1 (or later) or a Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later) operating 
system (OS). The UI can also be accessed via a Chrome browser 
enabled Android-based tablet or mobile device. To access the server, 
type your server’s IP address (for example, 10.10.20.12).
1.1.1
Whitelisted Web Addresses
E7000 requires access to specific Uniform Resource Locators (URLs), 
commonly referred to as web addresses. Access to many of these 
web addresses is required during installation; access to other web 
addresses, such as the address for the Network Time Server (NTS) are 
required during runtime. The Information Technology (IT) depart-
ment for the site must whitelist the web addresses so that they can 
be easily accessed as needed.
The following table lists the URLs that must be whitelisted.
Table 1-1, Whitelisted Web Sites
URL

http://hostedactivation.com/bogen)

qas.question: What capabilities does the E7000 Series intercom and paging solution offer for managing announcements?

answers.text: The E7000 Series intercom and paging solution allows users to control facility bell schedules, manage announcements, and create routines for audio playback at specific times, such as during class transitions. It also enables the creation and management of zones and queues for tailored communication throughout various administrative and staff locations.

qas.question: How does the E7000 system enhance emergency communications within a facility?

answers.text: The E7000 system enhances emergency communications by enabling the monitoring of check-in statuses during emergencies, such as lockdowns or evacuations, and allowing for the control of facility bell schedules, announcements, and tones. It simplifies routine and emergency notifications across multiple buildings or locations, ensuring timely and effective communication in critical situations.

qas.question: What types of devices are compatible with the E7000 system for accessing the Admin Web user interface?

answers.text: The E7000 system's Admin Web user interface is compatible with personal computers (PCs), tablets, and Android and Windows mobile phones that support the full Google Chrome web browser. Specifically, it requires devices running Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later).

qas.question: Which web browser is required to access the E7000 web-based UI?

answers.text: The E7000 web-based UI requires the Google Chrome web browser for access. It is compatible with computers or tablets running Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later), as well as Android-based devices with the Chrome browser.

qas.question: What are the main functions of the routines that the E7000 system can execute?

answers.text: The E7000 system can execute routines that can be manually started or automatically triggered based on input events. These routines involve executing specific procedures or sequences of actions, enhancing both routine and emergency network communications.

qas.question: What is the purpose of whitelisting specific URLs for the E7000 system?

answers.text: The purpose of whitelisting specific URLs for the E7000 system is to ensure that access to essential web addresses is available during installation and runtime, allowing for license support, necessary downloads, and proper functioning of various components of the system. This is crucial for maintaining seamless operation and integration with other services.

qas.question: What is the role of the Information Technology department regarding the E7000 system's web addresses?

answers.text: The Information Technology department is responsible for whitelisting specific web addresses required for the installation and runtime of the E7000 system. This ensures that users can easily access necessary URLs for functions such as license support, downloads, and Linux package installations.

qas.question: Which operating systems are supported for accessing the E7000 UI through a Chrome browser?

answers.text: The E7000 UI can be accessed through the Google Chrome web browser on computers or tablets running Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later). It can also be accessed via Chrome-enabled Android-based tablets or mobile devices.

qas.question: How can the E7000 system support scheduling audio playback for specific times?

answers.text: The E7000 system supports scheduling audio playback for specific times through its built-in streaming Internet radio service, airable by TuneIn, and optional custom-tailored music selections from SOUND-MACHINE. These services can be configured to automatically play audio during scheduled events, such as when classes change.

qas.question: What additional services does the E7000 feature integrate for music and streaming audio?

answers.text: The E7000 features a built-in streaming Internet radio service accessible via TuneIn and offers optional custom-tailored music selections from SOUND-MACHINE, a music subscription service for business. Both services can be scheduled to play audio at specific times, such as during class transitions.

qas.question: What type of network connection is required for the E7000 web-based UI?

answers.text: The E7000 web-based UI requires a secure Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (https) network connection to the E7000 system server. Users can access it using the Google Chrome web browser on supported operating systems.

qas.question: Which web browser is recommended for accessing the E7000 system?

answers.text: The recommended web browser for accessing the E7000 system is Google Chrome. Users can log in using Chrome on a computer or tablet with Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later), as well as on Chrome-enabled Android devices.

qas.question: What are the minimum operating system requirements for using the E7000 web-based UI?

answers.text: The minimum operating system requirements for using the E7000 web-based UI are Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later). Additionally, access can also be achieved using a Chrome browser on an Android-based tablet or mobile device.

qas.question: Can the E7000 system be accessed from a mobile device, and if so, which type?

answers.text: Yes, the E7000 system can be accessed from a mobile device, specifically through a Chrome browser enabled Android-based tablet or mobile device.

qas.question: What is the purpose of whitelisting specific web addresses for the E7000 system?

answers.text: Whitelisting specific web addresses for the E7000 system ensures that necessary resources, such as license support, software downloads, and sound files, can be accessed easily during both installation and runtime. This practice allows the system to operate effectively by permitting access to crucial external URLs while maintaining network security.

qas.question: Which URL is required for E7000 license support?

answers.text: The URL required for E7000 license support is http://hostedactivation.com, specifically http://hostedactivation.com/bogen. This URL must be whitelisted for proper access.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the URL http://downloads.digium.com?

answers.text: The URL http://downloads.digium.com is required for downloading the Digium Phone Module for Asterisk (DPMA). It facilitates the installation and integration of communication services associated with the Asterisk platform.

qas.question: For what purpose is the URL http://downloads.asterisk.org/ needed?

answers.text: The URL http://downloads.asterisk.org/ is required for downloading sound files specifically from the Asterisk project. This access is necessary during the installation and runtime of the E7000 system.

qas.question: Which URL does the E7000 system require for downloading PJSIP?

answers.text: The E7000 system requires the URL http://www.pjsip.org/ for downloading PJSIP. This URL must be whitelisted to ensure proper access.

qas.question: During which phase is access to http://ftp.us.debian.org necessary?

answers.text: Access to http://ftp.us.debian.org is necessary during the Linux package installation phase. It is specifically required for downloading the necessary packages for the installation process.

qas.question: What is the significance of the URL http://security.debian.org for the E7000 system?

answers.text: The URL http://security.debian.org is significant for the E7000 system because it is required during the Linux package installation process. Whitelisting this address ensures that the system can access necessary security updates and package management resources from Debian, which is vital for maintaining system security and stability.

1.1.2
E7000 System Server Requirements
The following are the minimum requirements for the E7000 system 
server if you elect to not use the Nyquist System Controller (NQ-
SYSCTRL):
Table 1-2,  E7000 System Server Minimum Requirements
OS
Debian Linux OS (AMD 64-bit version) release 8.9.0
Note: Refer to the most up to date Release Notes on the 
www.bogenedu.com web site for details about which Linux 
OS versions have been tested for use with the E7000 sys-
tem. 
CPU
Quad-core Intel-based processor running at 3.0 GHz or 
higher
Hardware
Sound card with microphone port
Memory
8 GB RAM (Error Correcting Code (ECC)) RAM is recom-
mended for increase performance and reliability.)
Disk Storage
One 250 GB disk drive
Some form of hardware-based Redundant Array of Inde-
pendent Disks (RAID) is recommended for redundancy and 
high availability.
Consider using a larger drive if large amounts of audio (for 
example, voice mail, announcements, recordings, and 
music) are being stored on the system. Note that music, 
tones, and announcements created or stored as .wav files 
will be larger than if created or stored as MP3 files. Other 
factors that should be considered are:
• How often will backups be performed?
• Will the system be backed up locally or remotely on a 
detachable drive, Storage Area Network (SAN)/Network 
Attached Storage (NAS), or Network File System (NFS)?
• How many users will have voicemail ability?
• How long will voicemail messages be stored?
• Will voicemail messages be part of the local system 
backups?

qas.question: What type of network connection is required for the E7000 web-based UI?

answers.text: The E7000 web-based UI requires a secure Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure (https) type network connection to the E7000 system server. Users can access the UI using the Google Chrome web browser from compatible Windows or Mac operating systems, as well as Android-based devices.

qas.question: Which web browser can be used to access the E7000 system?

answers.text: The E7000 system can be accessed using the Google Chrome web browser. It is compatible with computers or tablets running Windows 8.1 (or later) or Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later), as well as Android-based tablets or mobile devices.

qas.question: What operating systems are compatible with the E7000 web-based UI?

answers.text: The E7000 web-based UI is compatible with Windows 8.1 (or later) and Mac OS X 10.12.x (or later). It can also be accessed via a Google Chrome browser on Android-based tablets or mobile devices.

qas.question: What is the purpose of whitelisting specific URLs for the E7000?

answers.text: The purpose of whitelisting specific URLs for the E7000 is to ensure that the system can access essential resources required for installation and runtime operations. These URLs facilitate functions such as license support, downloading software and updates, and accessing time servers, which are critical for the system's performance and reliability.

qas.question: Which URL is required for E7000 License support?

answers.text: The URL required for E7000 License support is http://hostedactivation.com, specifically http://hostedactivation.com/bogen. Accessing this URL is necessary during the installation of the E7000 system.

qas.question: What are the default URLs for the STUN and TURN servers?

answers.text: The default URL for the STUN server is not set, while the default URL for the Network Time Server (NTS) is pool.ntp.org. The document does not specify a default URL for the TURN server.

qas.question: What is the minimum OS requirement for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The minimum OS requirement for the E7000 system server is Debian Linux OS, specifically the AMD 64-bit version release 8.9.0. For the most current compatibility details, it's recommended to refer to the Release Notes on the Bogen Education website.

qas.question: What type of processor is recommended for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The recommended processor for the E7000 system server is a quad-core Intel-based processor running at 3.0 GHz or higher. This ensures adequate performance for system operations.

qas.question: How much RAM is recommended for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The E7000 system server is recommended to have 8 GB of Error Correcting Code (ECC) RAM for increased performance and reliability.

qas.question: What disk storage capacity is required for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The E7000 system server requires a minimum of one 250 GB disk drive for disk storage. It is recommended to consider using a larger drive if large amounts of audio, such as voicemail, announcements, recordings, and music, are being stored on the system.

qas.question: Why is a hardware-based RAID recommended for the E7000 system?

answers.text: A hardware-based RAID is recommended for the E7000 system to ensure redundancy and high availability, minimizing the risk of data loss in case of hardware failure. This setup can significantly enhance system reliability, especially when handling large amounts of audio storage.

qas.question: What factors should be considered when determining disk storage size for audio files?

answers.text: When determining disk storage size for audio files, consider the frequency of backups, the backup method (local or remote), the number of users with voicemail capabilities, the retention period for voicemail messages, and the file formats used (e.g., .wav vs. MP3), as .wav files typically require more storage space.

qas.question: How can the county code for alerts be automatically found by the system?

answers.text: The county code for alerts can be automatically found by the system using the URL "https://ipapi.co" to obtain the public IP address of the Nyquist server, which is necessary for locating the relevant county code. Additionally, the resolver "ns1.google.com" and "resolver1.opendns.com" are required for this purpose.

qas.question: What URLs are necessary for obtaining alerts from the National Weather Service?

answers.text: The URLs necessary for obtaining alerts from the National Weather Service are https://api.weather.gov and https://www.weather.gov/alerts. These URLs are required for displaying weather alerts and obtaining alerts from the National Weather Service.

qas.question: What is the role of the Google Chrome browser in the context of the E7000 system?

answers.text: The Google Chrome browser is required for users to log in and access the E7000 web-based UI from computers or tablets running supported operating systems. It facilitates a secure connection to the E7000 system server over HTTPS. Additionally, access to certain whitelisted web addresses is necessary for the functionality of the system.

qas.question: What specific web address is required for downloading the TeamViewer software?

answers.text: The specific web address required for downloading the TeamViewer software is http://linux.teamviewer.com. This URL is necessary for the installation and updates of the Nyquist system, which includes TeamViewer.

Network Application Services
Required  application services will be installed automatically on the 
E7000 system server as part of the E7000 installation. All other net-
work services must be already present or installed manually on the 
associated network. The following table lists the services and their 
locations:
NIC
10/100/1000 MB Ethernet port (NIC is an acronym for 
Network Interface Card)
PCI Expansion Slots
One or more Peripheral Component Interconnect (PCI)/PCI 
Express (PCIe) slot if telephony network connectivity other 
than, or in addition to, SIP trunking is required; contact 
your Bogen Dealer for assistance in determining these tele-
phony hardware needs.
Telephony Interfaces
One or more PCI/PCIe type third-party telephony interface 
cards (for example, Foreign Exchange Office (FXO), Foreigh 
Exchange Subscriber (FXS), etc.) if telephony network con-
nectivity other than, or in addition to, SIP trunking is 
required; contact your Bogen Dealer for assistance in deter-
mining these telephony hardware needs.

qas.question: What is the minimum operating system requirement for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The minimum operating system requirement for the E7000 system server is Debian Linux OS (AMD 64-bit version) release 8.9.0. It is recommended to check the most up-to-date Release Notes on the Bogen website for tested Linux OS versions.

qas.question: What type of processor is recommended for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The recommended processor for the E7000 system server is a quad-core Intel-based processor running at 3.0 GHz or higher. This specification ensures adequate performance for the system's requirements.

qas.question: How much RAM is suggested for enhanced performance in the E7000 system?

answers.text: For enhanced performance in the E7000 system, 8 GB of Error Correcting Code (ECC) RAM is recommended. This type of RAM improves reliability, making it a preferable choice for the system's operation.

qas.question: What disk storage capacity is specified as a minimum requirement for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The minimum disk storage capacity specified for the E7000 system server is one 250 GB disk drive. It is recommended to consider a larger drive if significant amounts of audio are to be stored on the system.

qas.question: What type of network interface card (NIC) is required for the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The E7000 system server requires a 10/100/1000 MB Ethernet port as its network interface card (NIC). This NIC is essential for network connectivity and communication with associated devices.

qas.question: Which web server application is mandatory for the E7000 web interface?

answers.text: The mandatory web server application for the E7000 web interface is Apache. It is required for driving the web interface functionality of the E7000 system.

qas.question: What optional service provides dynamic IP addresses to the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The optional service that provides dynamic IP addresses to the E7000 system server is DHCP, which stands for Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol. DHCP also supplies the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server IP address or host name to devices on the network via option_66.

qas.question: What is the recommended storage solution for redundancy and high availability in the E7000 system?

answers.text: The recommended storage solution for redundancy and high availability in the E7000 system is some form of hardware-based Redundant Array of Independent Disks (RAID). It is suggested to consider using a larger disk drive if substantial amounts of audio data will be stored on the system.

qas.question: Which telephony interfaces may be needed for additional connectivity on the E7000 system?

answers.text: For additional telephony network connectivity on the E7000 system, one or more PCI/PCIe type third-party telephony interface cards may be needed, such as Foreign Exchange Office (FXO) or Foreign Exchange Subscriber (FXS) cards. It's recommended to contact your Bogen Dealer for assistance in determining the specific telephony hardware requirements.

qas.question: What factors should be considered when determining disk size for audio storage on the E7000 system?

answers.text: When determining disk size for audio storage on the E7000 system, consider the frequency of backups, whether backups are local or remote, the number of users with voicemail capability, the duration for storing voicemail messages, and if those messages are included in local backups. Additionally, note that audio files in .wav format will occupy more space than those in MP3 format.

qas.question: What network application services are automatically installed on the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The automatically installed network application services on the E7000 system server include Apache, NTP (Network Time Protocol), and TFTP (Trivial File Transfer Protocol). Additionally, SNMP (Simple Network Management Protocol) is optional and can provide server statistics.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the Apache service in the context of the E7000 system?

answers.text: The Apache service serves as the web server for the E7000 system, enabling the operation of the E7000 web interface. It is considered a mandatory service that must be installed on the E7000 system server.

qas.question: Which service supplies dynamic IP addresses to the E7000 system server and associated devices?

answers.text: The service that supplies dynamic IP addresses to the E7000 system server and associated devices is DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol). It also provides the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) server IP address or host name to devices on the network via option_66.

qas.question: How does the NTP service benefit the E7000 system and its devices?

answers.text: The Network Time Protocol (NTP) service provides essential date and time synchronization for the E7000 system server and its associated devices, such as IP phones and appliances. This synchronization is crucial for maintaining accurate time stamps for logs, scheduled tasks, and various communication protocols, ensuring seamless operation and coordination within the network.

qas.question: What is the function of the SNMP service concerning the E7000 Linux server?

answers.text: The SNMP (Simple Network Management Protocol) service provides statistics for the E7000 Linux server via SNMP v1 through Port 161. It is an optional service that facilitates monitoring and management of the server's performance.

qas.question: What ports are used for DHCP communication in the Nyquist system?

answers.text: The ports used for DHCP communication in the Nyquist system are 67 and 68. These ports facilitate the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol, which supplies dynamic IP addresses to the system server and associated devices.

qas.question: Which port is designated for HTTP phone provisioning?

answers.text: The port designated for HTTP phone provisioning is 8088. This port is used for the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) related to phone provisioning scenarios.

qas.question: What protocol is used for audio streaming in the Nyquist system, and what is the corresponding port range?

answers.text: The Nyquist system uses Real-Time Transport Protocol (RTP) for audio streaming, with the corresponding port range of 10000 to 20000.

qas.question: What optional service resolves host names to IP addresses within the network?

answers.text: The optional service that resolves host names to IP addresses within the network is DNS, which stands for Domain Name System. It is a hierarchical naming system used for computers, servers, or other resources connected to the Internet or private networks.

qas.question: Which PCI slots may be needed for telephony network connectivity beyond SIP trunking?

answers.text: One or more Peripheral Component Interconnect (PCI) or PCI Express (PCIe) slots may be needed for telephony network connectivity beyond SIP trunking, specifically for third-party telephony interface cards such as Foreign Exchange Office (FXO) or Foreign Exchange Subscriber (FXS). For assistance in determining telephony hardware needs, it is recommended to contact a Bogen Dealer.

1.1.5
Using the Web-Based User Interface
The web-based UI is an interactive dashboard that presents system 
information and parameters in an easy to read and use format. The 
view of the dashboard varies depending upon the permissions (the 
role) assigned to the user. See "Accessing the Dashboard” on page 12.
1.1.6
Client Requirements
The web-based UI is accessed through a client, which can run on PCs, 
tablets, and Android and Windows mobile phones that support the 
full Google Chrome web browser. In addition to supporting Chrome, 
the client must have a sound card with a microphone port and a 
Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate, which is also known as a digital 
certificate. The SSL certificate authenticates the identity of the E7000 
website and encrypts the data that is transmitted from the client to 
the server. If you do not install the SSL certificate, a lock with a red x 
appears when you attempt to access the E7000 system server.
1.1.6.1
Installing SSL Certificate on Windows System
To export the SSL certificate:
Step 1
From your Chrome browser, type the E7000 system 
server’s IP address in the address bar (for example, 
https://192.168.1.0).
Step 2
Select Advanced.
Step 3
Select to Proceed to <IP Address> (unsafe).

qas.question: What are the network ports listed for the Nyquist system controller and its associated devices?

answers.text: The network ports required by the Nyquist system controller and its associated devices include DHCP (67, 68), DNS (53), DUNDI (4520), HTTP (8088), HTTPS (8089, 443), IAX (4569), MGCP (2727), NTP (123), ODBC (3306), RTP (10000-20000), server management (5038), SIP (5060), SIP over Web Services (8088), SNMP (161), and TFTP (69). Each port serves specific functions related to system communication and management.

qas.question: Which port is used for DHCP in the Nyquist system?

answers.text: The Nyquist system uses ports 67 and 68 for DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol). This service is optional and facilitates dynamic IP address assignment in the network.

qas.question: What does the acronym RTP stand for, and what is its port range?

answers.text: RTP stands for Real-Time Transport Protocol. Its port range is 10000-20000.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the SSL certificate in relation to the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The SSL certificate authenticates the identity of the E7000 system server and encrypts the data transmitted between the client and the server. It ensures secure communication, preventing unauthorized access and data interception. Without the SSL certificate, users will see a warning indicating a potential security risk when accessing the server.

qas.question: Which web browser must the client support to access the web-based UI?

answers.text: The client must support the full Google Chrome web browser to access the web-based UI. Additionally, it requires a sound card with a microphone port and an SSL certificate for secure data transmission.

qas.question: What is the role of the port 5038 in the Nyquist system?

answers.text: Port 5038 in the Nyquist system is used for server management. It is crucial to restrict outside access to this port, as an IP filter rule is implemented during system controller installation to block any external connections.

qas.question: What should a user do if they see a lock with a red x when trying to access the E7000 system server?

answers.text: If a user sees a lock with a red x when trying to access the E7000 system server, it indicates that the SSL certificate is not installed. The user should install the SSL certificate to authenticate the website's identity and encrypt data transmission.

qas.question: Which protocol is used for phone provisioning and what is its associated port?

answers.text: The protocol used for phone provisioning is HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol), and its associated port is 8088.

qas.question: What does SNMP stand for and which port does it utilize in the Nyquist system?

answers.text: SNMP stands for Simple Network Management Protocol. In the Nyquist system, it utilizes port 161.

qas.question: How does the web-based UI differ based on the user's permissions?

answers.text: The web-based UI varies in presentation and accessibility based on the user's assigned role and permissions, affecting the information displayed and the functionalities available to the user. Higher privilege roles may have access to more advanced features and system settings, while lower roles might have a more restricted view and limited capabilities.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the web-based user interface (UI) for the E7000 system?

answers.text: The web-based user interface (UI) for the E7000 system serves as an interactive dashboard that presents system information and parameters in an easy-to-read format. It varies in view depending on the user's assigned permissions and enables access through compatible clients, including PCs and mobile devices.

qas.question: How does the view of the dashboard differ among users?

answers.text: The view of the dashboard varies based on the permissions assigned to each user role. Different roles may have access to different system information and parameters, affecting the visibility and functionality available on the dashboard.

qas.question: Which devices can access the web-based UI?

answers.text: The web-based UI can be accessed through PCs, tablets, and Android and Windows mobile phones that support the full Google Chrome web browser. Additionally, the client must have a sound card with a microphone port and a valid SSL certificate.

qas.question: What specific browser must clients use to access the web-based UI?

answers.text: Clients must use the full Google Chrome web browser to access the web-based UI. It is compatible with PCs, tablets, and Android and Windows mobile phones.

qas.question: Why is an SSL certificate important for accessing the E7000 system?

answers.text: An SSL certificate is important for accessing the E7000 system because it authenticates the identity of the E7000 website and encrypts the data transmitted between the client and the server. Without the SSL certificate, users will see a warning indicating an unsafe connection, which undermines security and data integrity.

qas.question: What happens if the SSL certificate is not installed when trying to access the E7000 system server?

answers.text: If the SSL certificate is not installed when trying to access the E7000 system server, a lock with a red 'x' will appear in the browser. This indicates that the connection is not secure and the identity of the E7000 website cannot be authenticated.

qas.question: What are the first two steps to export the SSL certificate using a Chrome browser?

answers.text: To export the SSL certificate using a Chrome browser, first, type the E7000 system server’s IP address (e.g., https://192.168.1.0) in the address bar. Then, select "Advanced."

qas.question: What does selecting “Proceed to <IP Address> (unsafe)” indicate in the process?

answers.text: Selecting “Proceed to <IP Address> (unsafe)” indicates that the browser has detected a potential security risk due to the absence of a valid SSL certificate for the E7000 system server. This action allows the user to continue accessing the server despite the warning, enabling the export of the SSL certificate.

E7000 System Server Requirements

1.1.5
Using the Web-Based User Interface
The web-based UI is an interactive dashboard that presents system 
information and parameters in an easy to read and use format. The 
view of the dashboard varies depending upon the permissions (the 
role) assigned to the user. See "Accessing the Dashboard” on page 12.
1.1.6
Client Requirements
The web-based UI is accessed through a client, which can run on PCs, 
tablets, and Android and Windows mobile phones that support the 
full Google Chrome web browser. In addition to supporting Chrome, 
the client must have a sound card with a microphone port and a 
Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate, which is also known as a digital 
certificate. The SSL certificate authenticates the identity of the E7000 
website and encrypts the data that is transmitted from the client to 
the server. If you do not install the SSL certificate, a lock with a red x 
appears when you attempt to access the E7000 system server.
1.1.6.1
Installing SSL Certificate on Windows System
To export the SSL certificate:
Step 1
From your Chrome browser, type the E7000 system 
server’s IP address in the address bar (for example, 
https://192.168.1.0).
Step 2
Select Advanced.
Step 3
Select to Proceed to <IP Address> (unsafe).
10
Step 4
From the Chrome menu, point to More tools and then 
select Developer tools.
Step 5
Navigate to the Security tab, and then select the View 
Certificate button.
Step 6
Select the Details tab, and then select Copy to File.
The Certificate Export Wizard launches.
Step 7
Select Next.
Step 8
Select Next again, browse to the location of the file 
that you want to export, and select Next. 
Step 9
Select Cryptographic Message Syntax Standard and 
Include all certificates in the certification path if 
possible.
Step 10
Select Finish.
To install the certificate to Windows:
Step 1
Right-click the certificate, and select Install Certificate.
The Certificate Import Wizard launches.
Step 2
Select Current User, and then select Next.
Step 3
Select Browse.
Step 4
Select Trusted Root Certificate Authorities, and then 
select OK.
Figure 1-2, Chrome Menu Selections
11
Step 5
Select Next.
Step 6
Select Finish.
Step 7
Restart the Chrome browser and log in to the E7000 
web server.
1.1.6.2
Installing SSL Certificate on Mac System
Step 1
From your Chrome browser, type the E7000 system 
server’s IP address in the address bar (for example, 
https://192.168.1.0).
Step 2
From the browser menu on the upper right of the 
screen, point to More Tools and then select Developer 
Tools.
Step 3
From the Security overview window, select View cer-
tificate.
The Certificate Details window appears.
Step 4
Drag the certificate image to the desktop.
Step 5
Double-click the certificate file on the desktop. 
The Keychain Access App opens.
Step 6
Double-click the certificate to reveal the trust settings.
Step 7
Change the top trust setting to Always Trust.
Step 8
Close the Trust Setting window and enter the computer 
administrative password to save.
Step 9
Reload the E7000 web page. If the green lock fails to 
appear in the RL, restart Chrome.
1.1.6.3
Installing SSL Certificate on an Android Device
To install the SSL certificate on an Android device:
Step 1
Type the certificate URL in the Chrome browser, using 
the format <E7000 server IP address>/ssl/ca.crt.
Step 2
When prompted, select Download.
Note: The Android device WiFi must be connected to the same 
network as the E7000 system server.

qas.question: What types of devices can access the E7000 web-based UI?

answers.text: The E7000 web-based UI can be accessed through PCs, tablets, and both Android and Windows mobile phones that support the full Google Chrome web browser. Additionally, the client devices must have a sound card with a microphone port and a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) certificate installed.

qas.question: What browser must be used to access the E7000 web-based UI?

answers.text: The E7000 web-based UI must be accessed through the full Google Chrome web browser. It is supported on PCs, tablets, and Android and Windows mobile phones. A sound card with a microphone port and an SSL certificate are also required.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the SSL certificate in relation to the E7000 system server?

answers.text: The SSL certificate authenticates the identity of the E7000 website and encrypts the data transmitted between the client and the server. Without the SSL certificate, users will see a security warning (a lock with a red x) when accessing the E7000 system server.

qas.question: What indication appears if the SSL certificate is not installed correctly?

answers.text: If the SSL certificate is not installed correctly, a lock with a red X appears when attempting to access the E7000 system server. This indicates that the connection is not secure and could be unsafe.

qas.question: What is the first step for exporting the SSL certificate on a Windows system?

answers.text: The first step for exporting the SSL certificate on a Windows system is to type the E7000 system server’s IP address in the Chrome browser's address bar (for example, https://192.168.1.0). Then, select "Advanced" and choose to proceed to the IP address, which is marked as unsafe.

qas.question: Which tab in the Chrome Developer Tools allows you to view the certificate?

answers.text: In the Chrome Developer Tools, the "Security" tab allows you to view the certificate. From there, you can select the "View Certificate" button to access the certificate details.

qas.question: What setting must be modified to ensure the SSL certificate is trusted on a Mac?

answers.text: To ensure the SSL certificate is trusted on a Mac, you need to change the top trust setting of the certificate to "Always Trust" in the Trust Settings window after double-clicking the certificate in the Keychain Access App. Additionally, you must enter the computer's administrative password to save the changes.

qas.question: How is the SSL certificate installed on an Android device?

answers.text: To install the SSL certificate on an Android device, type the certificate URL in the Chrome browser using the format <E7000 server IP address>/ssl/ca.crt, and when prompted, select Download. Ensure that the Android device is connected to the same WiFi network as the E7000 system server.

qas.question: What network requirement must be met for downloading the SSL certificate on an Android device?

answers.text: The Android device must be connected to the same WiFi network as the E7000 system server in order to download the SSL certificate.

qas.question: What actions should be taken if the green lock does not appear after installing the SSL certificate on a Mac?

answers.text: If the green lock does not appear after installing the SSL certificate on a Mac, try reloading the E7000 web page. If the issue persists, restart the Chrome browser.

Drag the certificate image to the desktop.
Step 5
Double-click the certificate file on the desktop. 
The Keychain Access App opens.
Step 6
Double-click the certificate to reveal the trust settings.
Step 7
Change the top trust setting to Always Trust.
Step 8
Close the Trust Setting window and enter the computer 
administrative password to save.
Step 9
Reload the E7000 web page. If the green lock fails to 
appear in the RL, restart Chrome.
1.1.6.3
Installing SSL Certificate on an Android Device
To install the SSL certificate on an Android device:
Step 1
Type the certificate URL in the Chrome browser, using 
the format <E7000 server IP address>/ssl/ca.crt.
Step 2
When prompted, select Download.
Note: The Android device WiFi must be connected to the same 
network as the E7000 system server.
12
Step 3
If prompted, verify your identity and enter your Per-
sonal Identity Number (PIN).
Step 4
Type the certificate name and select OK to install it.
Step 5
Verify the installation by selecting Settings > Lock 
Screen and Security > Other Security Settings 
>View Security Certificates. 
Step 6
Select the User column, select the certificate, and then 
select Certificate details.
1.1.6.4
Installing a Self-Signed CA Certificate on an iOS Device
To install a Self-Signed CA certificate on an iPhone Operating System
(iOS) device:
Step 1
Enter the certificate URL in the Safari browser, using the 
format <E7000 Server IP address>/ssl/ca.crt.
Step 2
Select Continue.
Step 3
When the Install Profile window appears, select Install.
Step 4
When the Warning screen appears, select Install.
Step 5
Select Install again to install the profile.
Step 6
Select Done.
Step 7
Verify the installation by selecting Settings > General 
> Profile.
Step 8
Select Details.
Step 9
Select the certificate.
1.1.7
Accessing the Dashboard
To access your dashboard:
Step 1
From your Chrome browser, type the E7000 system 
server’s IP address in the address bar (for example, 
https://192.168.1.0) and press Enter.
Step 2
On the Login page, type your username and password. 
Step 3
Select Login.
Note: The iOS device WiFi must be connected to the same network 
as the E7000 system server.

qas.question: How do you change the trust setting of a certificate in Keychain Access on a Mac?

After making the change, close the Trust Setting window and enter your administrative password to save the changes.

qas.question: What should you do if the green lock does not appear after reloading the E7000 web page on Chrome?

answers.text: If the green lock does not appear after reloading the E7000 web page on Chrome, restart the Chrome browser and log in to the E7000 web server again. Ensure that the SSL certificate installation was completed correctly on your system.

qas.question: Which network requirement must be met when installing the SSL certificate on an Android device?

qas.question: Which settings path do you follow to check the installed profiles on an iOS device?

answers.text: To check the installed profiles on an iOS device, navigate to Settings > General > Profile. From there, you can view the details of the installed certificates.

The dashboard that appears depends on whether your station is an 
Admin Web Interface or a non-administrator Web Interface.
If you are using the Admin Web Interface and have permissions for 
configuration tasks, your dashboard will appear like that in Figure 1-
4, E7000 Dashboard for Admin Web Interface. 
Figure 1-3,  Login Page
14
If you are logged in as a user and using the non-administrator Web 
Interface station Type, the dashboard will look like Figure 1-5, Non-
Administrator Web Interface.
Figure 1-4,  E7000 Dashboard for Admin Web Interface
Note: This manual describes the tasks, including configuration 
tasks, that you can perform if you are assigned an Admin role with 
proper permissions and if your station Type is an Admin Web 
Interface. If you are assigned a user role and your station’s Type is 
Web Interface, refer to the Non-Admin Web Interface User Guide 
and to "Performing Tasks Via the Dashboard” on page 331 of this 
manual. For information about station types, see "Managing Sta-
tions, Zones, and Queues” on page 105. For information about 
roles, see "Managing Roles and Users” on page 199.
15
Figure 1-5, Non-Administrator Web Interface
Figure 1-6, Dashboard Areas
16
The left side, or navigation bar, of the dashboard, lists the areas of the 
E7000 system that you can access. Accessibility to E7000 features and 
functionality is controlled by the user’s assigned role.
The right header ribbon provides the facility name, server time in 
hours and minutes, the username for the account and the extension 
for the station. The facility name and server time will not appear if the 
screen is reduced in size, such as when viewing from a phone or tab-
let.
Incoming Calls and Messages appear on the top right dashboard 
pane. 
The majority of the dashboard is set up to allow you to perform com-
munications activities, view this week’s bell schedules, and perform 
audio distribution.
The navigation bar does not appear for those users not authorized to 
make changes to the E7000 configuration. Instead, those users see 
only common tasks, such as calling an extension. See "Performing 
Tasks Via the Dashboard” on page 331 for details about tasks that 
office and teaching staff commonly perform. Chapter 9 of this 
manual can be distributed by itself to front office staff.
At the top of the dashboard, messages appear that can provide infor-
mation about your system, such as any stations or devices that were 
connected to your server but now are not appearing to be connected 
or responding. (See "Dashboard Messages” on page 324.)
If the dashboard message “System is running in demonstration 
mode” appears, all E7000 functions are enabled but the maximum 
station count is set to 6 and the maximum number of simultaneous 
calls is set to 2.
If an I/O Controller rule’s Action has been set to Manual, a dash-
board button appears that can be used to manually close or open 
specified output contact. (See "Viewing I/O Controller Configuration 
Rules” on page 120.)
On the lower part of the dashboard are options for Audio Distribu-
tion and an Enable/Disable Audio button that you can toggle to 
enable or disable audio.
17
For detailed information about performing tasks from the dashboard, 
see "Performing Tasks Via the Dashboard” on page 331.

qas.question: What steps are involved in installing a Self-Signed CA certificate on an iOS device?

answers.text: To install a Self-Signed CA certificate on an iOS device, enter the certificate URL in Safari, select "Continue," and then choose "Install" on the Install Profile window. After confirming the installation on the Warning screen, select "Done" and verify the installation in Settings > General > Profile by selecting "Details" and viewing the certificate.

qas.question: How can you verify the installation of a CA certificate on Android?

answers.text: To verify the installation of a CA certificate on an Android device, select Settings > Lock Screen and Security > Other Security Settings > View Security Certificates. Then, navigate to the User column, select the certificate, and choose Certificate details to confirm the installation.

qas.question: What is the process to access the E7000 dashboard from a Chrome browser?

answers.text: To access the E7000 dashboard from a Chrome browser, type the system server’s IP address (e.g., https://192.168.1.0) in the address bar and press Enter. On the Login page, enter your username and password, then select Login. Ensure that your iOS device is connected to the same network as the E7000 system server.

qas.question: What information is displayed in the right header ribbon of the E7000 dashboard?

answers.text: The right header ribbon of the E7000 dashboard displays the facility name, server time in hours and minutes, the username for the account, and the extension for the station. The facility name and server time may not appear if the screen size is reduced, such as when viewed on a phone or tablet.

qas.question: How does the Admin Web Interface dashboard differ from the Non-Administrator Web Interface?

answers.text: The Admin Web Interface dashboard includes permissions for configuration tasks, allowing access to advanced features and controls, while the Non-Administrator Web Interface dashboard is limited to common tasks, such as calling an extension. Additionally, the layout and options available will vary based on the user role, affecting what actions can be performed within the dashboard.

qas.question: What actions can users perform from the navigation bar on the E7000 dashboard?

answers.text: Users with appropriate permissions can access various areas of the E7000 system from the navigation bar on the dashboard, including performing configuration tasks, managing audio distribution, and viewing bell schedules. However, users without authorization to make changes will only see common tasks, such as calling an extension.

qas.question: What message indicates that the E7000 system is running in demonstration mode?

answers.text: The message indicating that the E7000 system is running in demonstration mode is "System is running in demonstration mode." In this mode, all E7000 functions are enabled, but the maximum station count is limited to 6 and the maximum number of simultaneous calls is set to 2.

qas.question: What functions do the Add, Edit, and Delete icons perform in the UI?

answers.text: In the UI, the Add icon allows you to add a new item, the Edit icon enables you to modify an existing item, and the Delete icon allows you to remove an item. These icons facilitate efficient management of items within the E7000 system interface.

qas.question: How can you enable or disable audio in the E7000 dashboard?

answers.text: To enable or disable audio in the E7000 dashboard, locate the "Enable/Disable Audio" button on the lower part of the dashboard and toggle it as needed. This button allows you to easily control the audio distribution settings for your system.

qas.question: What information is typically included in the top right dashboard pane?

answers.text: The top right dashboard pane typically displays Incoming Calls and Messages. It may also provide information about the facility name and server time, although these details will not appear if the screen size is reduced.

1.2
Configuring E7000
After E7000 is installed on your server, you must configure your 
system and the E7000 features to best suit your organizational needs. 
For example, you must determine if your E7000 server is being used 
for just your school or for a multi-school campus environment. An 
example of a multi-school campus environment is when a middle 
school and a high school are on the same campus.
The following table provides the suggested order for setting up your 
system and directs you to specific sections of the E7000 documenta-
tion for step by step instructions.
Note: If an E7000 system server is used in a multi-school campus 
environment, All-Call and Emergency All-Call pages broadcast at 
all schools managed by that E7000 system server. If you do not 
want this setup, then each school on the campus should have its 
own E7000 system server. A single E7000 system server should not 
be used to manage multiple schools that are geographically sepa-
rated since WLAN and power issues at one school could disrupt 
E7000 service at all locations.

Reference
Define the single stand-
alone school or deter-
mine the number of 
schools in a multi-school 
campus environment to 
be managed by the 
E7000 system server. 
Configure these via Schedules. (See "Adding a School” on 
page 217.)
Set the dialing length 
and other System 
Parameters to the 
desired values.
See "Setting System Parameters” on page 53.
Set the CoS configura-
tions.

Determine the number

qas.question: What types of UI inputs can be used to make selections in the dashboard?

answers.text: You can make selections in the dashboard using either a mouse click or touchscreen functionality. The user interface includes buttons with names and graphics, as well as icons that are graphics-only.

qas.question: What actions can be performed using the UI icons described in the context?

answers.text: The UI icons allow users to perform three key actions: the Add icon lets users add an item, the Edit icon enables users to edit an item, and the Delete icon allows users to delete an item. Each icon is represented by a graphic along with its corresponding name.

qas.question: What considerations should be made when determining E7000 usage in a multi-school campus?

answers.text: When determining E7000 usage in a multi-school campus, it is important to specify whether the server will manage multiple schools on the same campus or separate geographically. If using a single server for multiple schools, it may lead to All-Call and Emergency All-Call pages being broadcast to all schools, which could disrupt service due to WLAN and power issues; thus, each school should ideally have its own E7000 server.

qas.question: What is the consequence of using a single E7000 system server for geographically separated schools?

answers.text: Using a single E7000 system server for geographically separated schools can lead to disruptions in service, as WLAN and power issues at one school may affect E7000 functionalities at all locations. Therefore, it is recommended that each school on a separate geographic location has its own E7000 system server to ensure reliable operation.

qas.question: What is the first task to perform when setting up an E7000 system?

answers.text: The first task when setting up an E7000 system is to define whether it will be used as a standalone school or for managing multiple schools in a multi-school campus environment. This configuration should be accomplished via Schedules, as referenced in "Adding a School” on page 217.

qas.question: How can the dialing length and System Parameters be configured for the E7000?

answers.text: To configure the dialing length and other System Parameters for the E7000, refer to the section titled "Setting System Parameters" on page 53 of the E7000 documentation. This section provides detailed instructions for setting the desired values.

qas.question: Where can instructions for adding Admin Phones and Web Admin stations be found?

answers.text: Instructions for adding Admin Phones and Web Admin stations can be found in the section titled "Adding a Station," which is referenced on page 153 of the E7000 documentation.

qas.question: What does the All-Call and Emergency All-Call feature do in a multi-school environment?

answers.text: In a multi-school environment, the All-Call and Emergency All-Call features enable broadcasts to all schools managed by a single E7000 system server. This means that any announcements made using these features will be heard at every participating school, which may not be ideal if separate management is required for distinct schools.

qas.question: Which section of the documentation addresses setting CoS configurations?

answers.text: The section of the documentation that addresses setting CoS configurations is referenced as "Adding CoS Parameters for a Station" on page 67. This section provides step-by-step instructions for configuring the Class of Service (CoS) settings for the E7000 system.

qas.question: How should one approach defining the number of schools managed by an E7000 system server?

answers.text: To define the number of schools managed by an E7000 system server, assess whether the server will support a single standalone school or multiple schools within a multi-school campus environment. Consider any geographic separation, as a single server should not manage schools that are far apart due to potential WLAN and power issues affecting overall service. For further configuration, refer to the section on "Adding a School” on page 217.

1.3
Getting Help
Help is available through the E7000 web UI and through Bogen’s 
Technical Support. Technical Support is available between 8:30 am 
and 6:00 pm, and on-call until 8 pm, Monday through Friday. Techni-
cal Support contact information is as follows:
Tel: 1-800-999-2809
Fax: 201-934-6532
Email: Bogen Technical Support at techsupport-
orlando@bogen.com 
Online help is accessed from the menu that appears in the upper 
right portion of the web UI’s navigation pane. The menu contains the 
following options:
• About – Selecting this option displays the version number and 
contact information for Bogen Communications, Inc.
• Help Topics – Selecting this option 
• Admin Manual – Selecting this option displays the System Admin-
istrator Manual.
• Logout – Selecting this option logs you out of E7000.

qas.question: What configurations are necessary to determine the use of E7000 for a single school or a multi-school campus environment?

answers.text: To determine the use of E7000 for a single school or a multi-school campus environment, you must define whether the server will manage one standalone school or multiple schools on a campus. This setup is configured via schedules, and if multiple schools are involved, ensure that All-Call and Emergency All-Call pages broadcast at all managed schools unless separate servers are designated for each school.

qas.question: How can you set the dialing length and other System Parameters in the E7000?

answers.text: To set the dialing length and other System Parameters in the E7000, refer to the section titled "Setting System Parameters" on page 53 of the E7000 documentation. This section provides step-by-step instructions for configuring these settings to your desired values.

qas.question: What is the process for adding CoS parameters for a station?

answers.text: To add CoS (Class of Service) parameters for a station on the E7000 system, refer to the section titled "Adding CoS Parameters for a Station" on page 67 of the documentation. This process involves defining the desired CoS settings for the specific station to ensure proper prioritization and access rights.

qas.question: How do you determine and configure the number of Admin Phones and Web Admin stations?

answers.text: To determine and configure the number of Admin Phones and Web Admin stations, assess your organizational needs based on the size and structure of the environment. Then, follow the instructions in the documentation under "Adding a Station" on page 153 to add and configure the identified number of Admin Phones and Web Admin stations.

qas.question: What steps are involved in creating Admin Groups within the E7000 system?

answers.text: To create Admin Groups within the E7000 system, determine the number of groups needed and then follow the instructions provided in the documentation under the section titled "Adding an Admin Group" on page 215. This includes accessing the configuration menu in the web UI and inputting the necessary details for each group.

qas.question: How can you use the Discover Ports feature to configure outside lines?

answers.text: To use the Discover Ports feature to configure outside lines, access the feature through the E7000 interface, which allows you to identify and set up the ports for outside lines. Ensure that outside access is enabled for stations that are authorized to make or receive outside calls by editing their configuration settings accordingly.

qas.question: What should be done to configure staff IP phones or the non-admin web user interface?

answers.text: To configure staff IP phones or the non-admin web user interface, determine the number of devices planned and then configure these stations accordingly. Refer to "Adding a Station" on page 153 for detailed instructions on the configuration process.

qas.question: How can roles for the Web Admin and non-admin web interface be configured?

answers.text: Roles for the Web Admin and non-admin web interface can be configured by following the instructions provided in the "Adding a Role" section of the E7000 documentation. This process allows administrators to define specific permissions and access levels for different user roles within the system. For detailed steps, refer to "Adding a Role" on page 201 of the documentation.

qas.question: What is the procedure for configuring users for the Web Admin and non-admin web interface?

answers.text: To configure users for the Web Admin and non-admin web interface, refer to the section "Adding a User" on page 207 of the E7000 documentation. This section provides detailed instructions on defining and setting up user accounts for both interface types.

qas.question: How can VoIP speakers, I/O Controllers, or MMPAs be configured using E7000’s Auto Discovery feature?

answers.text: VoIP speakers, I/O Controllers, or MMPAs can be configured using E7000’s Auto Discovery feature by accessing the "Adding a Station" section in the E7000 documentation. This feature automatically detects and configures the devices within the network, simplifying the setup process for these components.

qas.question: What are the steps to configure page, time, and audio zones?

answers.text: To configure page, time, and audio zones in the E7000 system, first create separate time zones to ensure they take priority over page zones. Then, assign stations to the created zones as needed. Refer to the relevant sections "Adding a Zone" (page 169) and "Adding an Event" (page 227) for detailed instructions.

qas.question: How can tones for alarms or events, such as bells, be defined in E7000?

answers.text: To define tones for alarms or events, such as bells, in the E7000 system, you need to upload the desired tones by following the instructions provided in the documentation. Refer to "Uploading Tones" on page 294 for the specific steps to complete this task.

qas.question: What is involved in creating playlists and downloading songs within E7000?

answers.text: To create playlists and download songs within E7000, you need to follow the instructions in the documentation for "Adding Songs" on page 254 and "Creating a Playlist" on page 259. This process involves defining the songs you want to include in your playlists and organizing them according to your desired structure.

qas.question: How do you define school start and end dates in the E7000 system?

answers.text: To define school start and end dates in the E7000 system, navigate to the section for reviewing and editing schedules. Refer to the instructions provided in "Reviewing and Editing a Schedule" on page 222 of the documentation.

qas.question: What is the process for configuring events for bell schedules, including bells, tones, and Scheduled Audio?

answers.text: To configure events for bell schedules including bells, tones, and Scheduled Audio in the E7000 system, you must first create separate page and time zones, ensuring that the time zones are established first to prioritize them over page zones. Then, use the "Adding an Event" section in the documentation to define the specific events for your bell schedules.

qas.question: How can holidays be scheduled in the E7000 system?

answers.text: Holidays can be scheduled in the E7000 system by using the "Adding a Holiday" feature, as detailed on page 236 of the documentation. This allows users to define specific dates when school operations will be paused or adjusted in the scheduling system.

qas.question: What configuration steps are needed if a SIP trunk is being used?

answers.text: If a SIP trunk is being used, you need to add the SIP trunk configuration to the E7000, configure the station to use the SIP trunk for 911 calls, and add the SIP registration password to the station parameters. Refer to "Adding SIP Trunk Configuration Parameters” on page 72 and "Editing Station Configuration Settings” on page 118 for detailed instructions.

qas.question: How do you add multiple facilities to the E7000 system?

answers.text: To add multiple facilities to the E7000 system, refer to the section titled "Adding a Facility" in the documentation. Follow the instructions provided there to configure each facility within the E7000 system.

qas.question: What hours is Bogen’s Technical Support available?

answers.text: Bogen’s Technical Support is available Monday through Friday from 8:30 am to 6:00 pm, with on-call support until 8:00 pm.

qas.question: How can you access online help from the E7000 web UI?

answers.text: To access online help from the E7000 web UI, click on the menu in the upper right portion of the navigation pane. The menu will provide options including Help Topics, Admin Manual, and Logout.

istrator Manual.

Configuring Your System
The Admin Web UI allows you to configure most of your Nyquist 
system or gracefully restart or power down the Nyquist server 
through System Parameters (see "Setting System Parameters” on 
page 53). System configuration also includes the following:
• Setting parameters for what actions can be done from a specific 
station (see "Using CoS Configuration” on page 63)
• Setting what permissions are assigned to a user (see "Managing 
Roles and Users” on page 199)
• Configuring facilities for a multi-site server (see "Configuring Facil-
ities” on page 98)
• Setting up stations, zones, and queues (see "Managing Stations, 
Zones, and Queues” on page 105)
• Updating firmware for Nyquist devices and stations (see "Config-
uring Firmware” on page 91)
• Setting parameters for SIP trunks (see "Managing SIP Trunks” on 
page 67)
• Disabling an outside line (see "Editing Outside Lines” on page 87)
2.1
Understanding System Parameters
System parameters include key information that is unique to the sys-
tem, including passwords, night ring characteristics, and telephony 
settings. (For more information on night ring behavior, see "Setting 
Night Call Options” on page 31.)

qas.question: What are the hours of operation for Bogen's Technical Support?

answers.text: Bogen's Technical Support operates from 8:30 am to 6:00 pm, Monday through Friday, and is on-call until 8:00 pm.

qas.question: How can you contact Bogen Technical Support via email?

answers.text: You can contact Bogen Technical Support via email at techsupport-orlando@bogen.com. Technical Support is available Monday through Friday, from 8:30 am to 6:00 pm, and on-call until 8 pm.

qas.question: Where can online help be accessed in the web UI?

qas.question: What does the "About" option in the help menu display?

answers.text: The "About" option in the help menu displays the version number and contact information for Bogen Communications, Inc.

qas.question: What types of system configurations can be performed using the Admin Web UI?

answers.text: The Admin Web UI allows for system configurations such as setting parameters for actions at specific stations, managing user permissions, configuring facilities for multi-site servers, setting up stations, zones, and queues, updating firmware, managing SIP trunks, and disabling outside lines. It also facilitates graceful restarts or powering down the Nyquist server through system parameters.

qas.question: What does "Using CoS Configuration" refer to in the system configuration?

answers.text: "Using CoS Configuration" refers to setting parameters that determine what actions can be performed from a specific station within the system. This configuration plays a crucial role in managing call handling and ensuring appropriate access levels for different stations.

qas.question: How can user permissions be managed in the system?

answers.text: User permissions in the system can be managed through the "Managing Roles and Users" section, which allows administrators to assign specific permissions to users. This ensures that users have appropriate access to various system functionalities based on their assigned roles.

qas.question: What is involved in configuring facilities for a multi-site server?

answers.text: Configuring facilities for a multi-site server involves setting up the necessary parameters and specifications that govern the operations across different locations. This includes defining how resources are allocated, managing communication between sites, and ensuring proper integration of each facility within the overall system framework. For detailed guidance, refer to the section "Configuring Facilities" on page 98.

qas.question: How can you set up stations, zones, and queues in the system?

answers.text: To set up stations, zones, and queues in the Nyquist system, access the Admin Web UI and refer to the section titled "Managing Stations, Zones, and Queues" on page 105 for detailed instructions. This section will guide you through the configuration process required to establish these elements within the system.

qas.question: What is the process for updating firmware for Nyquist devices?

answers.text: To update firmware for Nyquist devices, access the Admin Web UI and navigate to the "Configuring Firmware" section. Follow the specific instructions provided there to perform the firmware update.

qas.question: What parameters must be set for SIP trunks?

answers.text: To set parameters for SIP trunks, you need to configure settings related to the SIP account credentials, server address, ports, and any necessary authentication details. Specific instructions can be found in the section titled "Managing SIP Trunks" on page 67 of the manual.

qas.question: How can you disable an outside line in the system?

answers.text: To disable an outside line in the system, navigate to the E7000 web UI and refer to the section labeled "Editing Outside Lines." Detailed instructions are provided there for disabling the line.

qas.question: What key information is included in system parameters?

answers.text: System parameters include key information unique to the system, such as passwords, night ring characteristics, and telephony settings. These parameters are essential for configuring the system's functionality and behavior.

qas.question: What additional information can be found regarding night ring behavior?

answers.text: Additional information regarding night ring behavior can be found in the section titled "Setting Night Call Options" on page 31 of the documentation. This section likely outlines the specific settings and configurations related to night ring features in the system.

qas.question: What are the steps for setting up stations, zones, and queues?

qas.question: How can you update the firmware for Nyquist devices and stations?

qas.question: What parameters need to be set for managing SIP trunks?

Viewing system parameters can aid in troubleshooting. For example, 
if your calls are not being routed to the proper day or night Admin 
Station, you should check that the system parameters settings for day 
start and night start time are correct.

qas.question: How can a user set permissions assigned to different users in the system?

qas.question: What steps are involved in viewing system parameters for troubleshooting?

qas.question: What is the purpose of the System Parameters page in the Admin Web UI?

answers.text: The System Parameters page in the Admin Web UI allows users to view and manage key settings unique to the Nyquist system, such as passwords, telephony settings, and night ring characteristics. It also provides options to export reports and enter product license activation keys, aiding in system configuration and troubleshooting.

qas.question: How can firmware updates for Nyquist devices be managed?

answers.text: Firmware updates for Nyquist devices can be managed through the Admin Web UI by accessing the "Configuring Firmware" section. Here, users can follow the necessary steps to update the firmware for both Nyquist devices and stations as needed.

qas.question: What information can be included in a report that is exported from the System Parameters page?

answers.text: The exported report from the System Parameters page can include key system settings unique to the facility, such as passwords, night ring characteristics, and telephony settings. This information can aid in troubleshooting and ensure proper configuration of the Nyquist system.

qas.question: In which section can settings for night ring characteristics be found?

answers.text: Settings for night ring characteristics can be found in the section titled "Understanding System Parameters." For more information on night ring behavior specifically, refer to "Setting Night Call Options" on page 31.
