qas.question: What occurs if Call Forwarding is enabled at an Admin Station and the forwarded extension is busy?

answers.text: If Call Forwarding is enabled at an Admin Station and the forwarded extension is busy, the call timeout is reduced to 15 seconds. After 15 seconds, if the call is still unanswered, it will roll over to the Admin Group.

qas.question: What additional information can be accessed by clicking the Show icon on the Admin Groups page?

answers.text: By clicking the Show icon on the Admin Groups page, you can access a description of the Admin Group and a list of the Admin Stations included in the group. This additional information helps to clarify the purpose and composition of the Admin Group.

answers.text: An Admin Station can be added to an Admin Group through the Edit Admin Group page by selecting the option to add Admin Stations. Additionally, an Admin Station can also be added to an Admin Group while adding or editing a station.

qas.question: Are there any limitations on displaying Admin Group parameters for certain devices?

answers.text: Yes, the Admin Group parameters are not displayed when adding or editing an I/O Controller or Matrix Mixer Pre-Amp as a station. This limitation is specific to those device types within the system.

answers.text: On the Edit Admin Group page, you can change the name, icon, and description of the Admin Group. Additionally, you can add or delete Admin Stations associated with the group.

qas.question: How can you add an Admin Station to an Admin Group?

answers.text: To add an Admin Station to an Admin Group, select the Admin Group you want to edit and go to the Edit Admin Group page. From there, you can provide a list of Admin Stations to include, or you can select "Add All" to include all available Admin Stations.

qas.question: Under what circumstances can an Admin Group not be deleted?

answers.text: An Admin Group cannot be deleted if it is associated with a station, an outside line, or a Day or Night Admin. To delete the Admin Group, one must first edit and remove any associations with these elements.

qas.question: What is the first step required to delete an Admin Group?

answers.text: The first step required to delete an Admin Group is to select the Delete icon next to the group that you want to delete. If the group is associated with a station, outside line, or Day or Night Admin, you must first dissociate those before proceeding to delete the Admin Group.

qas.question: What types of characters are valid when naming an Admin Group?

answers.text: Valid characters for naming an Admin Group include uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the special characters: !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: How can you select an icon for an Admin Group?

answers.text: To select an icon for an Admin Group, use the drop-down menu available on the Edit Admin Group page. From this menu, choose the desired icon to associate with the Admin Group.

qas.question: What actions are required before deleting an Admin Group associated with a station?

answers.text: Before deleting an Admin Group associated with a station, you must first edit the station, an outside line, or a Day or Night Admin to remove the association. Once the association is removed, you can proceed with the deletion of the Admin Group.

qas.question: What should you provide in the description field of an Admin Group?

answers.text: In the description field of an Admin Group, you should provide a clear and concise description that outlines the purpose or function of the group. Valid characters include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numerals, spaces, and specific special characters such as !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: Which steps must be taken to save changes after editing an Admin Group?

answers.text: To save changes after editing an Admin Group, select the Edit icon next to the desired group, make the necessary changes on the Edit Admin Group page, and then click Save after all changes have been made.

qas.question: What is the option to quickly include all Admin Stations in an Admin Group?

answers.text: To quickly include all Admin Stations in an Admin Group, you can select the "Add All" option available on the Edit Admin Group page. This will automatically select all available Admin Stations for inclusion in the group.

7.4
Adding an Admin Group
You can create an Admin Group and assign Admin Stations to it. No 
limit exists for the number of Admin Groups that you can create, and 
an Admin Station can belong to multiple Admin Groups.
If you want to route 911 calls from an extension (station) to an Emer-
gency Group, create an Admin Group called Emergency. Then, con-
figure the station to use this group for its 911 Route. (See "Editing 
Station Configuration Settings” on page 118.)
To add an Admin Group:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, select Admin Groups.
Step 2
On the Admin Groups page, select the Add icon.
Step 3
Enter the parameters on the Add Admin Groups page. 
Step 4
Select Save.
Table 7-3,  Add Admin Groups Page Parameters
Name
Enter the name of the Admin Group.
Note: Valid characters include uppercase letters (A-Z), low-
ercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the following 
special characters: !@$*?-.,.
Icon
Select an icon associated with an Admin Group. Associat-
ing an icon to an Admin Group offers a visual key to the 
type of group.
Admin Stations
Provide a list of Admin Stations that are to be included in 
this Admin Group. Only Admin Station types, such as a 
Web Admin UI or an Admin Phone, can be selected.
Description
Provide a description of the Admin Group.
Note: Valid characters include uppercase letters (A-Z), low-
ercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the following 
special characters: !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: What is the first step to edit an Admin Group?

answers.text: The first step to edit an Admin Group is to select the Edit icon next to the group you want to edit. This will take you to the Edit Admin Group page where you can make desired changes.

qas.question: What conditions prevent the deletion of an Admin Group?

answers.text: You cannot delete an Admin Group if it is associated with a station, an outside line, or a Day or Night Admin. To delete the Admin Group, you must first edit those associations to remove the link.

qas.question: How can an Admin Group be associated with an icon?

answers.text: An Admin Group can be associated with an icon by using the drop-down menu provided on the Edit Admin Group or Add Admin Groups page. This allows for the selection of a specific icon that visually represents the type of group, aiding in identification.

qas.question: What should you do if you want to delete an Admin Group that is linked to a station?

answers.text: To delete an Admin Group linked to a station, first, edit the associated station to remove the connection to that group. Once the station is no longer linked, you can proceed to delete the Admin Group by selecting the Delete icon and confirming the deletion.

qas.question: What characters are valid for naming an Admin Group?

answers.text: Valid characters for naming an Admin Group include uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the special characters: !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: Can an Admin Station be part of multiple Admin Groups?

answers.text: Yes, an Admin Station can belong to multiple Admin Groups. There is no limit on the number of Admin Groups that can be created.

qas.question: What are the steps to create a new Admin Group?

answers.text: To create a new Admin Group, first select "Admin Groups" from the navigation bar, then click the "Add" icon. Enter the required parameters on the Add Admin Groups page, and finally, select "Save" to complete the process.

qas.question: Which types of Admin Stations can be included in an Admin Group?

answers.text: Only Admin Station types, such as a Web Admin UI or an Admin Phone, can be included in an Admin Group. There is no limit to the number of Admin Groups that can be created, and an Admin Station can belong to multiple groups.

qas.question: What information is required in the description field when adding or editing an Admin Group?

answers.text: The description field for adding or editing an Admin Group requires a textual description of the group. Valid characters include uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and special characters such as !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: Is there a limit to the number of Admin Groups that can be created?

answers.text: No, there is no limit to the number of Admin Groups that can be created. Additionally, an Admin Station can belong to multiple Admin Groups.

Managing Schedules
The Schedules feature allows you to set tones and announcements to 
be played at specific times and in specific zones, set up holiday 
schedules, maintain calendar features, and schedule announcements, 
including recurring announcements.
Through the web-based UI, you can associate events (such as a tone 
that signals the end of visiting hours) to a schedule, select how a 
schedule appears on your dashboard, and edit event settings that 
include:
• Event name
• Signal time
• Zone
• Tone
• Scheduled Audio

qas.question: How can you route 911 calls to an Emergency Group using Admin Groups?

answers.text: To route 911 calls to an Emergency Group using Admin Groups, first create an Admin Group named "Emergency." Then, configure the specific station to use this Emergency Group for its 911 Route.

qas.question: What is the first step to add a new Admin Group?

answers.text: The first step to add a new Admin Group is to select "Admin Groups" from the navigation bar. Then, on the Admin Groups page, click the "Add" icon to proceed.

qas.question: What types of characters are valid for naming an Admin Group?

answers.text: Valid characters for naming an Admin Group include uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the special characters: !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: What purpose does associating an icon with an Admin Group serve?

answers.text: Associating an icon with an Admin Group serves as a visual key to easily identify the type of group. This enhances organization and quick reference within the Admin Groups interface.

qas.question: What types of stations can be included in an Admin Group?

answers.text: Only Admin Station types, such as a Web Admin UI or an Admin Phone, can be included in an Admin Group.

qas.question: What is the significance of the description field when adding an Admin Group?

answers.text: The description field when adding an Admin Group provides additional context about the group's purpose or function, aiding in identification and organization. This can be especially useful for distinguishing between multiple groups and ensuring clarity in the system's management.

qas.question: What features does the Schedules function provide for managing announcements?

answers.text: The Schedules function allows you to set tones and announcements to be played at specific times and in specific zones, as well as configure holiday schedules and recurring announcements. You can manage event settings such as event name, signal time, zone, tone, and scheduled audio through the web-based UI.

qas.question: How can you set up recurring announcements using the Schedules feature?

answers.text: To set up recurring announcements using the Schedules feature, navigate to the Schedules page in the web-based UI and create an event by selecting parameters such as the event name, signal time, zone, tone, and scheduled audio. You can then configure the event to recur at specified intervals according to your needs.

qas.question: What options are available when selecting a schedule for a school?

answers.text: When selecting a schedule for a school, you can choose start and end dates for the schedule or create a non-ending schedule. Additionally, you can assign an event name, signal time, zone, tone, and scheduled audio through the web-based UI.

qas.question: What specific settings can be edited for an event within a schedule?

answers.text: For an event within a schedule, you can edit the event name, signal time, zone, tone, and scheduled audio. These settings allow for customization of how and when events are presented.

8.1.1
Using School Settings
The Schools page provides parameters under Manage Schedules that 
can be added, viewed, and changed for a schedule. The following 
table describes these parameters:
Note: Valid characters include uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase 
letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the following special char-
acters: !@$*?-.,.
Table 8-1,  Settings Page Parameters
Day of the Week
Under Assign Schedules, select the schedule that is to be 
used for that day from the drop-down menu.
Start/End Dates
Use the slider to set to On if you want to enter start and 
end dates. If set to Off, the schedule continues indefinitely.
Start Date
Note: This option only appears if Start/End Dates is set to 
On.
Under School Year, use the calendar to select the start date 
for this schedule. By default, today’s date appears. When 
selecting a new Start Date, the date cannot be before the 
End Date.
End Date
Note: This option only appears if Start/End Dates is set to 
On.
Under School Year, use the calendar to select the end date 
for this schedule. By default, today’s date appears. The End 
Date must be after the Start Date.
Calendar Color
Use the drop-down menu to select the color for this sched-
ule that is used when the schedule appears on the dash-
board’s calendar view.

qas.question: What functions can the Schedules feature manage?

answers.text: The Schedules feature can manage tones and announcements scheduled for specific times and zones, holiday schedules, and recurring announcements. Users can set event details such as event name, signal time, zone, tone, and scheduled audio through a web-based interface. Additionally, it allows for the creation and customization of school schedules with start and end dates.

qas.question: How can a user create a non-ending schedule for a school?

answers.text: To create a non-ending schedule for a school, the user should go to the Schools page and select the Add icon. During the setup, they need to set the Start/End Dates slider to Off, which allows the schedule to continue indefinitely without specifying an end date.

qas.question: What parameters can be adjusted for a schedule on the Schools page?

answers.text: On the Schools page, parameters that can be adjusted for a schedule include the day of the week, start and end dates (which can be set to indefinite if desired), and the calendar color displayed on the dashboard. Additionally, users can assign specific schedules to days and set start and end dates using the calendar feature.

qas.question: What characters are considered valid for naming a school or schedule?

answers.text: Valid characters for naming a school or schedule include uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), spaces, and the special characters: !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: How does one select the schedule for a specific day of the week?

answers.text: To select the schedule for a specific day of the week, go to the Schools page under Manage Schedules, then under Assign Schedules, use the drop-down menu to select the desired schedule for that day.

qas.question: What happens when the Start/End Dates slider is set to Off?

answers.text: When the Start/End Dates slider is set to Off, the schedule continues indefinitely without a specified start or end date. This means it will remain active until manually changed or deleted.

qas.question: What conditions must be met when selecting a Start Date and End Date?

answers.text: When selecting a Start Date and End Date, the Start Date cannot be before the End Date, and the End Date must be after the Start Date. This condition ensures a valid timeline for the schedule.

qas.question: How can a user change the name of a school after it has been created?

answers.text: To change the name of a school after it has been created, a user should select the Edit icon next to the school name on the Schools page and then type the new name in the Edit School Name popup.

qas.question: What options are available for selecting the calendar color for a schedule?

answers.text: To select the calendar color for a schedule, you can use the drop-down menu provided in the School Settings section. This allows you to choose a specific color that will represent the schedule on the dashboard's calendar view.

qas.question: How can you rename a school once it has been created?

answers.text: To rename a school, expand the Schedules option on the navigation bar and select Schools. Click the Edit icon next to the school's name, type the new name in the popup box, and then select the Check icon to save the changes.

qas.question: What is the significance of the Start/End Dates setting for a schedule?

answers.text: The Start/End Dates setting allows you to specify a limited time frame for the schedule, enabling you to enter specific start and end dates. If set to Off, the schedule will continue indefinitely, while enabling it requires that the Start Date must be before the End Date.

qas.question: What characters are valid when renaming a school?

qas.question: How do you select a color for a schedule in the dashboard's calendar view?

answers.text: To select a color for a schedule in the dashboard's calendar view, go to the Schools page and use the drop-down menu under the Calendar Color setting. Choose the desired color for the schedule, which will be used when it appears on the calendar.

qas.question: What happens if you set the Start/End Dates option to Off?

answers.text: If you set the Start/End Dates option to Off, the schedule continues indefinitely without specified start or end dates. This means that the schedule will remain active until manually changed or removed.

qas.question: Where can you view events for a specific schedule related to a school?

answers.text: You can view events for a specific schedule related to a school from the Schools page. This page allows you to add, edit, or delete a schedule for a facility and view the associated events for that schedule.

qas.question: What steps are involved in renaming a school?

answers.text: To rename a school, expand Schedules on the navigation bar, select Schools, and click the Edit icon next to the desired school name. Enter the new name in the Edit School Name popup box and click the Check icon to save your changes.

qas.question: Which menu option do you expand to access Schools in the navigation bar?

8.4
Replacing a Schedule
If you attempt to delete a schedule that is in use, you are provided a 
chance to replace the schedule with another. If you select to delete 
rather than replace, then all matching default schedules and calendar 
exceptions are set to None. (See "Deleting a Schedule” on page 230.)
To replace a schedule:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, expand Schedules.
Step 2
Select Schools.
Step 3
Select the down arrow next to the site name.
Step 4
Select the Delete icon for the schedule.
Step 5
When prompted, select Replace.
Step 6
When prompted, use the drop-down menu to select the 
replacement schedule.
Step 7
Select Confirm Replace.
8.5
Reviewing and Editing a Schedule
Through the Schools page, you can select the start and end dates for 
the schedules, a name for the site, and a color that appears for the 
site schedule on the dashboard. You can then create one or more 
schedules and select the appropriate schedule for specific days of the 
week.
Any changes made to the Schools page affect the schedule going 
forward. For example, if you change the schedule for Tuesday and 
Thursday from Regular Day to Early Day, all Tuesdays and Thursdays 
until the End Date will use the Early Day schedule. If you want to 
change the schedule for days in a specific week, then you use the Cal-
endars feature to create an exception. (See "Using the Calendars Fea-
ture” on page 230.)
To review and edit a schedule:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, expand Schedules.
Step 2
Select Schools.
Step 3
Select the down arrow next to the site name.

qas.question: What are the steps to add a schedule for a site?

answers.text: To add a schedule for a site, expand Schedules on the navigation bar, select Schools, then click the down arrow next to the school name and the Add icon next to Manage Schedules. On the Add Schedule page, enter the Name and Description for the schedule, then select Save.

qas.question: What characters are valid when naming a schedule?

answers.text: Valid characters for naming a schedule include uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), spaces, and the special characters: !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: What happens if you try to delete a schedule that is currently in use?

answers.text: If you try to delete a schedule that is currently in use, you will be given the option to replace the schedule with another. If you choose to delete instead, all matching default schedules and calendar exceptions will be set to None.

qas.question: How can you replace a schedule after choosing to delete it?

answers.text: To replace a schedule after choosing to delete it, follow these steps: When prompted after selecting the Delete icon for the schedule, choose "Replace." Then, use the drop-down menu to select the replacement schedule and confirm the replacement.

qas.question: What options can you select when reviewing and editing a schedule?

answers.text: When reviewing and editing a schedule, you can select the start and end dates for the schedules, assign a name for the site, and choose a color that represents the site schedule on the dashboard. Additionally, you can create one or more schedules and specify the appropriate schedule for specific days of the week.

qas.question: How do changes made on the Schools page affect a schedule?

answers.text: Changes made on the Schools page affect the schedule going forward, meaning that if you modify a schedule for specific days (e.g., changing Tuesday and Thursday from Regular Day to Early Day), all corresponding days until the End Date will reflect that change. To adjust schedules for specific weeks, the Calendars feature should be used to create exceptions.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the Calendars feature mentioned in the context?

answers.text: The Calendars feature allows users to create exceptions to the regular schedule for specific days in a given week, rather than applying changes to all future occurrences. This enables more precise scheduling adjustments when needed.

qas.question: How can you create exceptions for specific days in a schedule?

answers.text: To create exceptions for specific days in a schedule, use the Calendars feature. This allows you to create exceptions for days in a specific week, overriding the regular schedule settings.

8.6
Viewing Events for a Schedule
An event is the scheduled sounding of a tone or the playing of 
Scheduled Audio. You add events to a schedule. For example, you 
can schedule a tone to sound at 8 am as an event such as the start of 
a shift. You can add a second event that has the tone sound at 10 am 
for a scheduled break.
To review events for a schedule:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, expand Schedules.
Step 2
Select Schools.
Step 3
Select the down arrow next to the site name.
Schedules that are associated with the site appear on 
the Edit Settings page. 
Step 4
To view the events for a schedule, select the Edit icon 
for a schedule.
The Events page appears. The following table describes 
the parameters for this page:
Figure 8-5, Events Page
224
Table 8-2,  Events Page Parameters
Name
Specifies the name for the event.
Note: Valid characters include uppercase letters (A-Z), low-
ercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the follow-
ing special characters: !@$*?-.,.
Signal Time
Specifies the time for this event to launch using the 
HH:MM:SS format. 
Zone
Specifies the zones to be included in this event.
Note: If you want tones to play during active pages, you 
must create separate page and time zones and the time 
zones must be created first. Creating time zones first sets 
the priority of time zones over page zones. Stations can be 
in multiple zones. See "Adding a Zone” on page 169.
Note:  You can select Add All to have all zones appear in 
the zone field, and then remove a zone by selecting the X 
for a zone. You can also delete zones by placing your cur-
sor in the Zones field and pressing the Delete key.
Tone
Select the desired tone for this event.
Scheduled Audio
Specifies if the event includes Scheduled Audio, and if so, 
what playlist, Matrix Mixer Pre-Amp channel, or amplifier is 
used for this event. If an Airable/SOUNDMACHINE source 
is selected, the Scheduled Audio list includes selections to 
start or stop the audio stream.
Display Event Name
Specifies if the event name will appear on the GA10PV dis-
plays associated to the event zone or zones.
Note: If you schedule an event with Display Event Name 
enabled, the event remains on the display connected to 
the NQ-GA10PV until the next scheduled event replaces it. 
To clear the event name from the display, create another 
scheduled event with the Name set to No-Event.

qas.question: What format is used to specify the Signal Time for an event?

answers.text: The Signal Time for an event is specified using the HH:MM:SS format. This format represents hours, minutes, and seconds, ensuring precise scheduling of events.

qas.question: How can you remove a zone from the events page once all zones are added?

answers.text: To remove a zone from the events page after all zones are added, place your cursor in the Zones field and press the Delete key next to the specific zone you want to remove. Alternatively, you can select the X next to the zone you wish to delete.

qas.question: What happens if the Display Event Name option is enabled for a scheduled event?

answers.text: If the Display Event Name option is enabled for a scheduled event, the event name will appear on the GA10PV displays associated with the event's zones. qas.question: What is the significance of creating time zones before page zones?

answers.text: Creating time zones before page zones is significant because it sets the priority of time zones over page zones, ensuring that tones play during active pages as intended. This organization allows for more effective management of audio events by preventing scheduling conflicts.

qas.question: What does the Scheduled Audio parameter allow you to specify for an event?

qas.question: How can an event be deleted from a schedule?

answers.text: To delete an event from a schedule, expand Schedules in the navigation bar, select Schools, and click the down arrow next to the site name. Then, click the Edit icon for the schedule, select the Delete icon for the event you want to remove, and confirm the deletion when prompted.

qas.question: Which icon is used to add a new event to a schedule?

answers.text: To add a new event to a schedule, you select the Add icon on the Events page after expanding Schedules, selecting Schools, and choosing the Edit icon for the desired schedule.

qas.question: What page appears after selecting the Edit icon for a schedule?

answers.text: After selecting the Edit icon for a schedule, the Events page for that schedule appears, displaying the events associated with it. From this page, you can edit, delete, or add events.

qas.question: What is a reason for deleting an event from a schedule?

answers.text: A reason for deleting an event from a schedule could be that the event is no longer needed or wanted, such as discontinuing the use of warning bells that ring before a shift starts. This helps to keep the schedule relevant and free from outdated events.

qas.question: What should you do after making changes on the Edit Event page?

answers.text: After making changes on the Edit Event page, you should select Save to apply the modifications. This will update the event with your changes.

qas.question: How do you access the Events page associated with a schedule?

answers.text: To access the Events page associated with a schedule, expand the Schedules menu on the navigation bar, select Schools, then click the down arrow next to the site name. Finally, select the Edit icon for the desired schedule to view the Events page.

qas.question: What function does the down arrow next to the site name serve?

answers.text: The down arrow next to the site name allows you to expand the view to access additional options related to the selected site. This includes selecting the Edit icon for the schedule associated with that site.

qas.question: How do you know when to update the playlist for Scheduled Audio?

answers.text: You should update the playlist for Scheduled Audio when there is a need to change the content being played, such as adjusting for different events or periods, like lunch. Additionally, if you want to add or remove specific zones affected by the event, that would also indicate a need for an update.

qas.question: What does an event consist of in the context of scheduling?

answers.text: In the context of scheduling, an event consists of specific times when tones play, such as warning bells or scheduled audio. Events can be edited to change parameters like playlists or zones affected, and they can also be added or deleted from a schedule as needed.

8.9
Deleting an Event 
You can delete an event from a schedule when the event is no longer 
needed or wanted. For example, suppose your site’s schedule was set 
up to have warning bells that ring five minutes before a shift starts. If 
you decide to end the use of warning bells, you would delete each 
warning bell event from the schedule.
To delete an event:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, expand Schedules.
Step 2
Select Schools.
Step 3
Select the down arrow next to the site name.
Step 4
Select the Edit icon for the schedule.
Events that are associated with the schedule appear on 
the Events page.
Step 5
Select the Delete icon for the event that you want to 
delete from the schedule.
Step 6
When prompted, select Delete.
8.10
Adding an Event
When a schedule is created, it has no events, which are specific times 
when tones play. After you create a schedule, you add events 
through the Add Event page.
To add an event to a schedule:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, expand Schedules.
Step 2
Select Schools.
Step 3
Select the down arrow next to the site name.
Step 4
Select the Edit icon for the schedule you want to add 
an event to.
Step 5
Select the Add icon.

qas.question: What steps are involved in editing an event on the Edit Event page?

answers.text: To edit an event on the Edit Event page, navigate to the desired event, make the necessary changes as outlined in "Understanding Event Settings," and then select Save to apply the changes.

qas.question: How can you delete an event from a schedule?

answers.text: To delete an event from a schedule, expand Schedules on the navigation bar, select Schools, and then click the down arrow next to the site name. Next, select the Edit icon for the relevant schedule, then click the Delete icon for the event you wish to delete and confirm by selecting Delete when prompted.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the warning bell events mentioned in the context?

answers.text: The purpose of the warning bell events is to alert individuals five minutes before a shift starts. These events serve as reminders to ensure timely preparation for the upcoming shift.

qas.question: What initial state does a schedule have in terms of events?

answers.text: When a schedule is created, it initially has no events. Events, which are specific times when tones play, must be added through the Add Event page after the schedule is established.

qas.question: What interface element must be selected to add an event to a schedule?

answers.text: To add an event to a schedule, you must select the Add icon after opening the Edit page for the desired schedule. This is done by expanding Schedules, selecting Schools, choosing the site name, and clicking the Edit icon for that schedule.

qas.question: What action is taken after selecting the Delete icon for an event?

answers.text: After selecting the Delete icon for an event, you are prompted to confirm the deletion. You must then select Delete to finalize the action.

qas.question: Upon deleting an event, what prompt confirms the deletion process?

answers.text: When prompted to confirm the deletion process, select "Delete" to finalize the removal of the event from the schedule. This prompt ensures that you acknowledge the action before it is completed.

qas.question: Where do you find the Edit icon for a schedule?

answers.text: You can find the Edit icon for a schedule by expanding the Schedules section on the navigation bar, selecting Schools, and then clicking the down arrow next to the site name. This will allow you to access the Edit icon for the desired schedule.

8.10.1
Understanding Event Settings
Event settings appear when adding or editing an event.
Table 8-3,  Event Settings Page Parameters
Name
Specifies the name for the event.
Note: Valid characters include uppercase letters (A-Z), low-
ercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the follow-
ing special characters: !@$*?-.,.
Signal Time
Specifies the time for this event to launch using the 
HH:MM:SS format. If you want the event to start at 
08:15:15, you would use the down arrows to make the 
appropriate selections in the Hour, Minute, and Second 
fields.
Zone
Specifies the zones to be included in this event. If an audio 
distribution entry from the Scheduled Audio menu is 
selected, this field is not required.
Note:  You can select Add All to have all zones appear in 
the zone field, and then remove a zone by selecting the X 
for a zone. You can also delete zones by placing your cur-
sor in the Zones field and pressing the Delete key.
Tone
Select the desired tone for this event. If an audio distribu-
tion entry from the Scheduled Audio menu is selected, 
this field is not required.

qas.question: What steps are involved in editing an event within a schedule?

answers.text: To edit an event within a schedule, expand Schedules on the navigation bar and select Schools. Then, choose the site name, click the Edit icon for the desired schedule, and make the necessary changes on the Edit Event page before selecting Save.

qas.question: How can a user delete an event from a schedule?

answers.text: To delete an event from a schedule, the user should expand Schedules on the navigation bar, select Schools, then click the down arrow next to the site name and the Edit icon for the schedule. They can then select the Delete icon for the desired event and confirm the deletion when prompted.

qas.question: What does the “Add Event” page allow a user to do?

answers.text: The “Add Event” page allows a user to define specific times for events within a schedule by completing parameters such as the event name, signal time, zones, and tone. Users can save the event or choose to add another event immediately afterward.

qas.question: What are the valid characters allowed for naming an event?

answers.text: The valid characters allowed for naming an event include uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the special characters: !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: In what format should the signal time be specified for an event?

answers.text: The signal time for an event should be specified using the HH:MM:SS format. For example, to set the event to start at 08:15:15, the appropriate selections should be made in the Hour, Minute, and Second fields.

qas.question: How can zones be selected for an event during the setup process?

answers.text: Zones can be selected for an event by specifying them in the Zone field during the setup process. You can select "Add All" to include all zones, and then remove specific zones by selecting the X next to them, or delete zones by placing the cursor in the Zones field and pressing the Delete key.

qas.question: What is the purpose of the tone selection in the event settings?

answers.text: The tone selection in the event settings allows you to specify the desired sound that will play when the event is triggered. This feature is optional if an audio distribution entry from the Scheduled Audio menu is selected for the event.

qas.question: What option allows a user to add all zones to an event simultaneously?

answers.text: The option that allows a user to add all zones to an event simultaneously is the "Add All" button. This feature populates the zone field with all available zones, which can then be modified by removing any unwanted zones.

qas.question: What should a user do if they want to delete a zone after adding it to an event?

answers.text: To delete a zone after adding it to an event, the user should place their cursor in the Zones field and press the Delete key. Alternatively, they can select the X next to the zone they wish to remove.

Scheduled Audio
Specifies if the event includes Scheduled Audio, and if so, 
what playlist, Matrix Mixer Pre-Amp channel, or amplifier is 
used for this event. You can also select to stop the Sched-
uled Audio by selecting Stop Playlist or Stop Line-Input.

8.11
Deleting a Schedule
If you have the correct permissions, you can delete a schedule that is 
no longer being used. When you delete a schedule, you delete all 
associated schedules, ed events, and schedule exceptions.
To delete a schedule:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, expand Schedules.
Step 2
Select Schools.
Step 3
Select the Delete icon next to the schedule that you 
want to delete.
Step 4
When prompted, select Delete.
8.12
Using the Calendars Feature
Nyquist provides a calendar view of the schedule used for past days, 
the schedule for the current and future days, and the scheduled holi-
days. The view is for the current month, but you can use the <Prev> 
and <Next> buttons to display other months.

qas.question: What parameters are specified when adding or editing an event in the event settings?

answers.text: The parameters specified when adding or editing an event in the event settings include the event Name, Signal Time, Zone, Tone, Scheduled Audio, Display Event Name, Amplifiers/Matrix Mixers, and Input Channel. The Name can include specific characters, while the Signal Time is set in HH:MM:SS format. Other parameters pertain to audio settings and the visibility of the event name on displays.

qas.question: Which characters are considered valid for naming an event?

answers.text: Valid characters for naming an event include uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), spaces, and the special characters: !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: How is the signal time formatted when setting an event?

answers.text: The signal time is specified using the HH:MM:SS format. For example, to set the event to start at 08:15:15, you would select the appropriate values in the Hour, Minute, and Second fields.

qas.question: What should you do if you want to include all zones in an event?

answers.text: To include all zones in an event, select "Add All" in the Zone field. You can then remove any specific zone by clicking the X next to it, if needed.

qas.question: What happens if an associated Stop event is not created for a scheduled audio event?

answers.text: If an associated Stop event is not created for a scheduled audio event, the Scheduled Audio started by the scheduled event will continue to play indefinitely. This can lead to overlapping audio from multiple scheduled events if not managed properly.

qas.question: How can you start Scheduled Audio without playing a tone?

answers.text: To start Scheduled Audio without playing a tone, set the Tone option to "No Tone" when configuring the event. Additionally, zone numbers are not required in this case.

qas.question: What selections are available for Scheduled Audio in relation to starting or stopping audio streams?

answers.text: For Scheduled Audio, you can select options to start or stop the audio stream, including playlists, Matrix Mixer Pre-Amp channels, or amplifiers. Additionally, if using an Airable/SOUNDMACHINE source, you can specifically select to start or stop the audio stream.

qas.question: How does enabling the Display Event Name affect the GA10PV displays?

answers.text: Enabling the Display Event Name will cause the event name to appear on the GA10PV displays associated with the specified event zones. This event name will remain on the display until the next scheduled event replaces it; to clear it, another scheduled event with the name set to "No-Event" must be created.

qas.question: What steps must be taken to delete a schedule in the system?

answers.text: To delete a schedule in the system, expand the Schedules section on the navigation bar, select Schools, then click the Delete icon next to the desired schedule. Confirm the deletion by selecting Delete when prompted.

qas.question: What feature does Nyquist offer for viewing schedules and holidays?

answers.text: Nyquist offers a calendar feature that provides a view of past schedules, the current and future schedules, and scheduled holidays. Users can navigate through different months using the <Prev> and <Next> buttons to display specific dates.

qas.question: What happens if an existing Scheduled Audio event is already playing in a zone when a new event is triggered?

answers.text: If an existing Scheduled Audio event is already playing in a zone when a new event is triggered, the audio will not start, and error messages will be displayed on the dashboard. This occurs to prevent overlapping zones in Scheduled Audio events during the same time frames.

qas.question: What steps are required to delete a schedule in the Nyquist system?

answers.text: To delete a schedule in the Nyquist system, expand the Schedules section on the navigation bar, select Schools, and click the Delete icon next to the desired schedule. Confirm the deletion when prompted by selecting Delete.

qas.question: How does the Calendars feature in Nyquist assist users in viewing schedules?

answers.text: The Calendars feature in Nyquist allows users to view schedules for past, current, and future days, as well as scheduled holidays, all within a calendar format. Users can navigate between months using the <Prev> and <Next> buttons, making it easy to access various time frames.

qas.question: Can you delete individual scheduled audio events, or do you have to delete the entire schedule?

answers.text: You cannot delete individual scheduled audio events; you must delete the entire schedule, which also removes all associated events and schedule exceptions.

qas.question: What happens to associated events and exceptions when a schedule is deleted?

answers.text: When a schedule is deleted, all associated events and schedule exceptions linked to that schedule will also be deleted. This action removes everything related to the schedule from the system.

qas.question: How can users navigate between different months in the calendar view?

answers.text: Users can navigate between different months in the calendar view by using the <Prev> and <Next> buttons, which allow them to display the schedule for the previous or next month.

8.12.1
Schedule Page Parameters
The Schedule page appears when viewing events for a date from 
either the monthly view (see section "Using the Calendars Feature” on 
page 230) or from the dashboard’s This Week’s Schedules section 
(see "Viewing the Schedule for the Week” on page 352).
The Schedule page displays the name, the day, and the date of the 
schedule. It also contains the following parameters:
Figure 8-9, Schedule Page
Table 8-4,  Schedule Page Parameters
Time
Identifies the time of the event start in HH:MM:SS format.
Name
Identifies the user provided name for the event.
Note: Valid characters include uppercase letters (A-Z), low-
ercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the following 
special characters: !@$*?-.,.
Zones
Identifies the zones and types of zones that are specified 
for this event.

qas.question: What happens if a Scheduled Audio event overlaps with an existing event in the same zone?

answers.text: If a Scheduled Audio event overlaps with an existing event in the same zone, the audio will not start, and error messages will be displayed on the dashboard to indicate the conflict. It is essential to ensure that scheduled events do not use the same zones at the same time.

qas.question: What steps are required to delete a schedule in the system?

answers.text: To delete a schedule, expand Schedules on the navigation bar, select Schools, and then click the Delete icon next to the desired schedule. Finally, confirm the deletion when prompted by selecting Delete.

qas.question: How can users change the schedule for specific days using the Calendars feature?

answers.text: Users can change the schedule for specific days using the Calendars feature by expanding Schedules, selecting Calendars, and ensuring they are on the tab for their site. They can then use the drop-down menu for the date or dates to select the replacement schedule.

qas.question: What information is displayed on the Schedule page for a specific date?

answers.text: The Schedule page for a specific date displays the event time in HH:MM:SS format, the user-provided name for the event, and identifies the zones and types of zones specified for that event. It also shows the name of the schedule, the day, and the date.

qas.question: What valid characters can be used for naming an event in the schedule?

answers.text: Valid characters for naming an event in the schedule include uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), spaces, and the special characters: !@$*?-.,.

qas.question: How does the Calendars feature facilitate creating exceptions for regular schedules?

answers.text: The Calendars feature allows users to easily modify regular schedules by creating exceptions for specific dates. For instance, if an Early Release schedule is typically used on Wednesdays, users can quickly apply this schedule to additional days, such as Monday through Friday, for a designated week by utilizing the drop-down menu to select replacement schedules.

qas.question: What does the error message indicate when Scheduled Audio cannot start?

answers.text: The error message indicates that Scheduled Audio cannot start because there is already an existing Scheduled Audio event playing in a zone defined for the new event. It highlights that overlapping zones during the same time frames prevent the Scheduled Audio from initiating.

qas.question: Which navigation steps are involved in accessing the Calendars feature?

answers.text: To access the Calendars feature, expand the Schedules section on the navigation bar, then select Calendars. From there, you can choose either the Top View or the tab displaying your site’s name.

qas.question: What parameters are displayed on the Schedule page for each event?

answers.text: The Schedule page displays the time of the event start in HH:MM:SS format, the user-provided name for the event, and the specified zones and types of zones for that event. Valid characters for event names include uppercase and lowercase letters, numerals, spaces, and certain special characters.

8.13
Using the Holidays Management Tool
Holidays, which can be a single day or a range of dates, often require 
changes in schedule assignments. The holidays management tool 
allows you to enter ranges of days when all schedules are turned off 
and to add these holidays to the calendar via the Schedules feature. 
You can also export a holiday schedule as a .csv file and import the holi-
day schedule file to another Nyquist server. 
Holidays override other schedules that are set for a date range.
8.13.1
Viewing Holidays
Holidays affect the schedule of each facility managed by your 
Nyquist server. The Holidays page displays a list of all holidays that 
have been set up for the Nyquist system. Holidays take precedent 
over regular schedules. For example, suppose you configure Mon-
days to use a schedule called Regular that has tones sounding 
throughout the day to mark the ending and beginning of shift 
changes. If you set a holiday for Monday, May 28, then the holiday 
“overrules” the Regular schedule and tones do not sound during that 
day.
To view holidays:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, expand Schedules.
Step 2
Select Holidays.
A listing of holidays and the parameters associated with 
these holidays appears. 
Figure 8-10, Holidays Page

qas.question: What parameters are displayed on the Schedule page?

answers.text: The Schedule page displays parameters including the event start time (in HH:MM:SS format), the user-provided name for the event, the specified zones for the event, the name of the tone used, and any scheduled audio options (e.g., playlists or sources). The parameters provide essential information for managing event schedules and audio settings.

qas.question: How is the time formatted for events on the Schedule page?

answers.text: The time for events on the Schedule page is formatted in HH:MM:SS format. This specifies the hours, minutes, and seconds of the event's start time.

qas.question: What types of characters are valid in the event name?

qas.question: How does the Scheduled Audio feature function on the Schedule page?

qas.question: How can holidays be exported and imported in the Nyquist system?

qas.question: What happens to regular schedules when a holiday is set?

answers.text: When a holiday is set, it overrides regular schedules for that date range. For example, if a regular schedule with tones is configured for Mondays, setting a holiday on a Monday will prevent those tones from sounding that day.

Using the Holidays Management Tool
Holidays, which can be a single day or a range of dates, often require 
changes in schedule assignments. The holidays management tool 
allows you to enter ranges of days when all schedules are turned off 
and to add these holidays to the calendar via the Schedules feature.

day schedule file to another Nyquist server.

8.13.1
Viewing Holidays
Holidays affect the schedule of each facility managed by your 
Nyquist server. The Holidays page displays a list of all holidays that 
have been set up for the Nyquist system. Holidays take precedent 
over regular schedules. For example, suppose you configure Mon-
days to use a schedule called Regular that has tones sounding 
throughout the day to mark the ending and beginning of shift 
changes. If you set a holiday for Monday, May 28, then the holiday 
“overrules” the Regular schedule and tones do not sound during that 
day.
To view holidays:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, expand Schedules.
Step 2
Select Holidays.
A listing of holidays and the parameters associated with 
these holidays appears. 
Figure 8-10, Holidays Page

238
8.13.6
Importing Holidays
If you have exported a holiday schedule created at one Nyquist 
server System Controller, you can import that schedule to another 
Nyquist server or System Controller.
You can also create a custom holiday .csv file using the following 
conventions:
• Create four columns with each column separated by commas.
• Insert a line return at the end of each row.
• Set the first column 0 because it will be replaced by an auto-gen-
erated value when the file is imported into the database.
• For first, second, and third columns, enclose the entries in double 
quotes (“).
• In the second column, provide the holiday name.
• Enter the start date in the third column using the format YYYY-
MM-DD.
• Enter the end date in the fourth column using the format YYYY-
MM-DD. For a one day holiday, the start and end dates will be the 
same.
To import a holiday schedule:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, expand Schedules.
Step 2
Select Holidays.
Step 3
Select Import.
Step 4
Select Choose file and navigate to select the .csv file 
that you want to import.
Step 5
If you want to delete all existing holidays before 
importing the file, use the slider to select Yes.
Step 6
Select Import.

qas.question: How do you delete a holiday from the holiday schedule?

answers.text: To delete a holiday from the holiday schedule, expand Schedules on the navigation bar, select Holidays, and then click the Delete icon next to the holiday you wish to remove. Confirm the deletion when prompted by selecting Delete.

qas.question: What steps are involved in editing a holiday's details?

answers.text: To edit a holiday's details, expand Schedules on the navigation bar, select Holidays, and then click the Edit icon next to the desired holiday. Make the necessary changes on the Edit Holiday page and select Save to finalize the updates.

qas.question: What file format is used for exporting the holiday schedule?

answers.text: The holiday schedule is exported in a .csv file format. This file will be saved in your Downloads folder upon export.

qas.question: What must be included in a custom holiday .csv file for importing?

answers.text: A custom holiday .csv file must include four columns: the first column should be set to 0, while the second column contains the holiday name in double quotes, the third column has the start date in the format YYYY-MM-DD, and the fourth column has the end date in the same format. Each entry in the file should be separated by commas, with a line return at the end of each row.

qas.question: What happens to the first column in the imported holiday .csv file?

answers.text: In the imported holiday .csv file, the first column is set to 0 because it will be replaced by an auto-generated value when the file is imported into the database. This ensures that each entry receives a unique identifier upon import.

qas.question: How is the start date formatted when creating a holiday?

answers.text: The start date for creating a holiday must be entered using the format YYYY-MM-DD. This format ensures consistency and clarity when inputting dates in the holiday schedule.

qas.question: Can you delete existing holidays before importing a new holiday schedule?

answers.text: Yes, you can delete existing holidays before importing a new holiday schedule. During the import process, there is an option to use a slider to select "Yes" if you want to delete all existing holidays prior to the import.

qas.question: What action prompts you to save changes made to a holiday?

answers.text: The action that prompts you to save changes made to a holiday occurs after you make the desired changes on the Edit Holiday page. Once all changes have been made, you need to select the Save option to preserve those modifications.

qas.question: Where is the exported holidays.csv file located after download?

answers.text: The exported holidays.csv file will be located in your Downloads folder after download.

qas.question: What is the significance of enclosing holiday entries in double quotes in the .csv file?

answers.text: Enclosing holiday entries in double quotes in the .csv file ensures that any commas within the holiday names or dates do not disrupt the structure of the data, allowing for accurate parsing during the import process. This is essential for maintaining the integrity of each entry across the defined columns.

8.14
Using the Schedule Announcement Feature
After an announcement has been created via the Audio feature, you 
can schedule it to play via the Schedules feature. For information 
about the Audio feature, refer to "Managing Audio” on page 247.
To view schedule announcements:
Step 1
On the navigation bar, expand Schedules.

Select Schedule Announcements.
The Schedule Announcements page appears. This page displays the 
following information about all scheduled announcements:
Figure 8-12, Schedule Announcements Page
Table 8-6,  Schedule Announcements Page Parameters
Name
Displays the name of the announcement.
Note: Valid characters include uppercase letters (A-Z), low-
ercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the following 
special characters: !@$*?-.,.
Description
Displays the description of the announcement.
Note: Valid characters include uppercase letters (A-Z), low-
ercase letters (a-z), numerals (0-9), space, and the following 
special characters: !@$*?-.,.
Signal Date
Displays the date that the announcement is to play.
Signal Time

format.
Zone

qas.question: What happens to the first column value during the import process of a holiday schedule?

qas.question: Which feature must be used to schedule announcements after they have been created?

qas.question: What is the purpose of the slider option when importing a holiday .csv file?

qas.question: How can users access the holiday import feature in the system?

qas.question: What specific information is displayed on the Schedule Announcements page?

qas.question: What parameters can be set when adding a schedule announcement?

answers.text: When adding a schedule announcement, you can set parameters such as the announcement selection, signal date and time (if not recurring), zone (All Speakers or specific), recurrence settings, and optional recurrence data like start/end dates, intervals, and specific days of the week or month. Additionally, you can choose to allow for indefinite recurrences.

qas.question: How do you manually play an announcement on the Schedule Announcements page?

answers.text: To manually play an announcement on the Schedule Announcements page, select the Playback option associated with the announcement you wish to play. Clicking the down arrow in this field also allows you to download and save the announcement.

qas.question: What happens if an announcement is already playing when a recurring announcement is scheduled?

answers.text: If an announcement is already playing, a recurring announcement will not play until its next scheduled occurrence. This means that the current announcement must finish before the recurring announcement takes effect.

qas.question: In which section of the navigation bar can you find the Schedule Announcements option?

answers.text: You can find the Schedule Announcements option under the "Schedules" section of the navigation bar. To access it, expand the Schedules section first.

qas.question: What must be created before adding a schedule announcement?

answers.text: Before adding a schedule announcement, you must first create an announcement. The creation of the announcement is a prerequisite for scheduling it.

qas.question: How can you specify the zone for a scheduled announcement?

answers.text: To specify the zone for a scheduled announcement, select either "All Speakers" or a specific zone from the Zone dropdown menu on the Add Schedule Announcement page. This determines which speakers will receive the announcement.

qas.question: What options are available for recurrence settings when adding a schedule announcement?

answers.text: When adding a schedule announcement, the recurrence settings include options to specify a start and end date for the recurrence, the option for "No End Date" to recur indefinitely, and dropdown selections for the recurrence interval by second, minute, hour, day, month, and day of the week. If "Recurring" is set to "Yes," additional fields for these parameters become available.

qas.question: How can you delete a scheduled announcement from the Schedule Announcements page?

answers.text: To delete a scheduled announcement from the Schedule Announcements page, expand Schedules on the navigation bar and select Schedule Announcements. Then, click the Delete icon next to the announcement you wish to remove and confirm the deletion when prompted.

qas.question: What does the No End Date slider do in the Add Schedule Announcement parameters?

answers.text: The No End Date slider in the Add Schedule Announcement parameters allows you to set the announcement to recur indefinitely if selected to "Yes." This means the announcement will continue to play according to the defined recurrence schedule without a specified end date.

qas.question: What happens if no specific day is selected for a recurring announcement?

answers.text: If no specific day is selected for a recurring announcement, it will default to play every day. Similarly, if no specific hour, minute, or month is selected, the announcement will recur every hour, every minute, and every month, respectively.

qas.question: What happens if you do not select an hour for a recurring announcement?

answers.text: If you do not select an hour for a recurring announcement, the default setting will be that the announcement plays every hour. This means it will repeat hourly until a specific hour is designated.

qas.question: How can you edit a schedule announcement after it has been created?

answers.text: To edit a schedule announcement after it has been created, expand Schedules on the navigation bar and select Schedule Announcements. Then, click the Edit icon next to the desired announcement, make the necessary changes, and select Save to apply the updates.

qas.question: What should you do to stop an announcement from playing in its original zone?

answers.text: To stop an announcement from playing in its original zone, you must use the stop announcement feature after changing the zone for the Schedule Announcement. Simply editing the zone does not automatically stop the announcement in the original zone.

qas.question: How can you retrieve the first and last scheduled events for a daily schedule?

qas.question: What is the default setting for recurrence if no specific day is selected?

qas.question: How can you determine if a schedule announcement is part of a recurring schedule?

answers.text: To determine if a schedule announcement is part of a recurring schedule, check if the "Recurring" option is set to "Yes." Additionally, recurrence-related fields such as Recurrence Hour, Recurrence Day, Recurrence Month, and Recurrence Day of the Week will appear, indicating that the announcement will repeat based on the selected criteria.

9 Managing Audio
247
Managing Audio
With Nyquist’s audio file management feature, you can:
• Specify an audio program for distribution to stations or zones.
• Record and play tones and announcements to stations or zones.
• Manage recordings of telephone calls made to and from stations.
Audio programs for distribution to stations or zones can include line-
input from the MMPA, Nyquist 2-channel or 4-channel amplifiers, 
user supplied songs or playlists, and Internet Radio Services. The 
Audio Distribution, tones, and announcement files added through 
the audio file management feature can be set through the Schedules 
feature to automatically play during specified times. (See "Managing 
Schedules” on page 217.) Through the Internet Radio Services, you 
can listen to live radio stations and add media catalogs and music 
services without updating devices or software. 
Default tone and song files include white noise and pink noise that 
allows you to tune paging and audio distribution volumes. 
Note: Before using the audio file management feature, make sure 
that stations and zones have been configured (see "Managing Sta-
tions, Zones, and Queues” on page 105) and that the station you are 
using to launch announcements, tones, or Audio Distribution has 
the appropriate CoS parameters set (see "Using CoS Configuration” 
on page 63).

qas.question: What can be changed when editing a Schedule Announcement?

answers.text: When editing a Schedule Announcement, you can change the selected announcement, the date and time it is scheduled to play, and the zones in which the announcement will be played. If you modify the zone for an announcement currently playing, it will play to both the original and new zones unless you stop it from the original zone.

qas.question: How can you stop an announcement from playing in an original zone?

answers.text: To stop an announcement from playing in the original zone, you must use the stop announcement feature as outlined in the “Managing Announcements Via the Dashboard” section. Simply changing the zone will not stop the announcement in the original zone.

qas.question: What information can be retrieved from the schedules-boundary.xml file?

answers.text: The schedules-boundary.xml file provides information about the first and last scheduled events for a daily schedule or indicates if the day's active schedule is a holiday. It displays start and end events for each school managed by the Nyquist server, and if it’s a holiday, the word “Holiday” will appear in the file.

qas.question: How do you access the .xml file for the first and last scheduled events?

answers.text: To access the .xml file for the first and last scheduled events, type the IP address of your Nyquist server followed by `:8088/static/schedules-boundary.xml` in your browser and press Enter. Ensure there is no space between the server’s IP address and the colon.

qas.question: What features does Nyquist’s audio file management allow users to manage?

answers.text: Nyquist’s audio file management feature allows users to specify audio programs for distribution to stations or zones, record and play tones and announcements, and manage recordings of telephone calls made to and from those stations. It also supports automated playback of audio files during specified times through the Schedules feature.

qas.question: What types of audio programs can be specified for distribution to stations or zones?

answers.text: Audio programs for distribution to stations or zones can include line-input from the MMPA, Nyquist 2-channel or 4-channel amplifiers, user-supplied songs or playlists, and Internet Radio Services. These programs can be scheduled to play automatically at specified times.

qas.question: What are the default tone files included in Nyquist’s audio management?

answers.text: The default tone files included in Nyquist’s audio management are white noise and pink noise. These tones allow users to tune paging and audio distribution volumes.

qas.question: What must be configured before using the audio file management feature?

answers.text: Before using the audio file management feature, ensure that stations and zones have been configured appropriately, and that the station used to launch announcements, tones, or audio distribution has the correct Class of Service (CoS) parameters set.

9 Managing Audio
247
Managing Audio
With Nyquist’s audio file management feature, you can:
• Specify an audio program for distribution to stations or zones.
• Record and play tones and announcements to stations or zones.
• Manage recordings of telephone calls made to and from stations.
Audio programs for distribution to stations or zones can include line-
input from the MMPA, Nyquist 2-channel or 4-channel amplifiers, 
user supplied songs or playlists, and Internet Radio Services. The 
Audio Distribution, tones, and announcement files added through 
the audio file management feature can be set through the Schedules 
feature to automatically play during specified times. (See "Managing 
Schedules” on page 217.) Through the Internet Radio Services, you 
can listen to live radio stations and add media catalogs and music 
services without updating devices or software. 
Default tone and song files include white noise and pink noise that 
allows you to tune paging and audio distribution volumes. 
Note: Before using the audio file management feature, make sure 
that stations and zones have been configured (see "Managing Sta-
tions, Zones, and Queues” on page 105) and that the station you are 
using to launch announcements, tones, or Audio Distribution has 
the appropriate CoS parameters set (see "Using CoS Configuration” 
on page 63).
248
9.1
Audio Distribution
Suppose you want to use an audio source, such as a radio station 
accessed via the Internet, in a cafeteria but prevent that source from 
being played in a conference room. This feature, called Audio Distri-
bution, can be turned on by zone (an area or group of stations) or 
stations (group of devices such as VoIP speakers). You can add the 
speakers, or stations, in the cafeteria to a zone that allows Audio Dis-
tribution while the speakers in a conference room would not be 
placed into that zone.
Audio Distribution involves creating a playlist or selecting an input 
source and specifying which zones hear the playlist or input source. 
Through the Scheduled Audio feature, Audio Distribution can be tied 
to a specific event in a schedule (see "Adding an Event” on page 227).
Figure 9-1, Audio Distribution Sources

qas.question: What audio programs can be specified for distribution to stations or zones?

answers.text: Audio programs for distribution to stations or zones can include line-input from the MMPA, Nyquist 2-channel or 4-channel amplifiers, user-supplied songs or playlists, and Internet Radio Services. These audio sources can be set to play automatically during specified times using the Schedules feature.

qas.question: How can tones and announcements be recorded and played to specific stations or zones?

answers.text: Tones and announcements can be recorded and played to specific stations or zones by utilizing the audio file management feature in Nyquist. This feature allows for audio programs to be configured for target stations or zones, with playback scheduled automatically for designated times.

qas.question: What types of audio sources can be included in Audio Distribution?

answers.text: Audio Distribution can include line-input from MMPA, Nyquist 2-channel or 4-channel amplifiers, user-supplied songs or playlists, and Internet Radio Services. It allows for the management of audio sources to play in designated zones or stations.

qas.question: How can the Schedules feature be utilized in managing audio playback?

answers.text: The Schedules feature allows you to set specific times for audio programs, tones, and announcements to automatically play in designated stations or zones. By linking audio playback to a schedule, you can ensure that the desired audio content is delivered at the right moments without manual intervention.

qas.question: What default tone and song files are provided for tuning audio distribution volumes?

answers.text: The default tone and song files provided for tuning audio distribution volumes include white noise and pink noise. These tones assist in adjusting paging and audio distribution volumes effectively.

qas.question: What is needed to configure stations and zones before using the audio file management feature?

answers.text: Before using the audio file management feature, you need to ensure that stations and zones have been configured correctly. Additionally, the station used to launch announcements, tones, or Audio Distribution must have the appropriate Class of Service (CoS) parameters set.

qas.question: How can Audio Distribution be utilized to control playback in different areas like a cafeteria and a conference room?

answers.text: Audio Distribution allows you to control playback by designating specific zones or stations for audio sources, such as a radio station. For instance, you can include the speakers in a cafeteria in a zone that permits audio playback while excluding the speakers in a conference room from that zone, thus preventing the audio source from playing there.

qas.question: What role does the Scheduled Audio feature play in Audio Distribution?

answers.text: The Scheduled Audio feature allows Audio Distribution to be linked to specific events in a schedule, enabling automatic playback of audio sources in designated zones or stations at predetermined times. This ensures that audio content, such as playlists or input sources, is played in accordance with the schedule set for various locations.

qas.question: How does the configuration of CoS parameters impact audio announcements and distributions?

answers.text: The configuration of CoS (Class of Service) parameters is crucial for ensuring that the station used to launch audio announcements, tones, or audio distributions has the necessary settings for prioritization and management. If the CoS parameters are not appropriately set, the audio announcements and distributions may not function correctly or may not be routed to the intended stations or zones.

qas.question: What is the benefit of using Internet Radio Services in conjunction with Nyquist’s audio management features?

answers.text: The benefit of using Internet Radio Services with Nyquist’s audio management features is that it allows for access to live radio stations and the addition of media catalogs and music services without the need for device or software updates. This enhances audio programming flexibility and enables the seamless integration of audio sources for varied environments like cafeterias and conference rooms.

9.1
Audio Distribution
Suppose you want to use an audio source, such as a radio station 
accessed via the Internet, in a cafeteria but prevent that source from 
being played in a conference room. This feature, called Audio Distri-
bution, can be turned on by zone (an area or group of stations) or 
stations (group of devices such as VoIP speakers). You can add the 
speakers, or stations, in the cafeteria to a zone that allows Audio Dis-
tribution while the speakers in a conference room would not be 
placed into that zone.
Audio Distribution involves creating a playlist or selecting an input 
source and specifying which zones hear the playlist or input source. 
Through the Scheduled Audio feature, Audio Distribution can be tied 
to a specific event in a schedule (see "Adding an Event” on page 227).

• SoundMachine Stations

qas.question: What is the purpose of Audio Distribution in a Nyquist system?

answers.text: The purpose of Audio Distribution in a Nyquist system is to control audio playback across different zones, allowing specific audio sources, such as Internet radio or user-supplied music, to be played in designated areas while restricting it in others. This feature enables tailored audio experiences based on the specific needs of different environments, like a cafeteria versus a conference room.

qas.question: How can Audio Distribution be configured for specific areas like a cafeteria and conference room?

answers.text: Audio Distribution can be configured by creating zones that group specific speakers together. For example, speakers in the cafeteria can be added to a zone that allows Audio Distribution, while speakers in the conference room are not included in that zone, thus preventing them from playing the designated audio source.

qas.question: What types of sources can be used for Audio Distribution?

answers.text: Audio Distribution sources can include audio from two-channel or four-channel audio power amplifiers or MMPAs line inputs, user-supplied music (songs and playlists), Internet Radio Services, and SoundMachine stations.

qas.question: How does the Scheduled Audio feature relate to Audio Distribution?

answers.text: The Scheduled Audio feature allows Audio Distribution to be linked to specific events in a schedule, enabling selected audio sources to play at designated times. This integration ensures that audio output can be controlled and tailored for different zones, such as a cafeteria or conference room, based on the schedule.

qas.question: What audio sources are available for management in a Nyquist system with power amplifiers?

answers.text: In a Nyquist system with two-channel or four-channel audio power amplifiers or MMPAs, the available audio sources for management include audio from the power amplifiers' line inputs, user-supplied music (songs and playlists), Internet Radio Services, and SoundMachine Stations. These sources can be organized for Audio Distribution across different zones.

qas.question: What are the differences between zone-based and station-based Audio Distribution?

answers.text: Zone-based Audio Distribution allows you to group speakers in specific areas, like a cafeteria, enabling simultaneous playback of a selected audio source while excluding others, like a conference room. In contrast, station-based Audio Distribution focuses on managing individual devices (e.g., VoIP speakers), allowing for more granular control over what each device plays regardless of the zone configuration.

qas.question: Can Audio Distribution include user-provided music and playlists?

answers.text: Yes, Audio Distribution can include user-supplied music, songs, and playlists as part of its sources. This allows for customizable audio experiences in designated zones.

qas.question: What types of audio amplifiers or MMPAs are mentioned in the context?

qas.question: How are the input configurations determined for amplifiers and MMPAs?

The available Input Channel selections range from 1 or 2 for amplifiers to 1 to 4 for MMPAs, and these selections are made when creating an audio distribution.

qas.question: What feature allows users to create and manage a playlist of songs?

qas.question: What default audio tracks are provided to assist in volume tuning?

answers.text: The default audio tracks provided to assist in volume tuning are white noise and pink noise songs. These tracks are available to help tune the volume of an audio distribution zone.

qas.question: How can a user view the song list in the system?

qas.question: What happens if a song is deleted from the song list while it is in a Playlist?

answers.text: If a song is deleted from the song list while it is in a Playlist, it is automatically removed from the Playlist. This ensures that the Playlist does not contain any songs that are no longer available.

qas.question: What input connection options are available for configuring amplifiers and MMPAs?

qas.question: How can songs be uploaded to the system for inclusion in playlists?

qas.question: What are the input channel selection ranges for a two-channel amplifier versus an MMPA?

answers.text: For a two-channel audio power amplifier, the input channel selection ranges from 1 to 2. In contrast, for a Matrix Mixer Power Amplifier (MMPA), the input channel selection ranges from 1 to 4.

9.1.4
Playing Songs Directly from a USB Memory 
Stick
You can use a USB memory stick as storage for songs that can be 
played via the playlists feature.
To add songs and create a playlist for a USB memory stick, you must 
create a root file on the USB memory stick called MusicLibrary.txt. 
This file can contain the following entries:
• playlistname=<text entered by customer>
• createplaylist=no
• useexistingplaylist=yes
If createplaylist=no is found in MusicLibrary.txt, a playlist is not cre-
ated for the imported files.
If useexistingplaylist=yes is used, new songs will be added to the 
playlist defined by the playlistname option.
Music files must be on the root directory of the USB memory stick. 
Valid formats for these files are mp3, wav, and aac.
The Nyquist server automatically mounts the USB memory stick, adds 
all songs found in the root directory to the songs list, and creates a

qas.question: What types of inputs can be configured for the amplifiers and MMPAs?
